Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in former East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: heljarskin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suit which was on the 7th floor excellent room with a big window so you could see for miles over the roof tops. Some furniture getting a little bit tired like the dining table. Small Kitchenet with coffe maker and cooler. The room was clean and well taken care off about medium hard bed but we slept well. The staff which we meet was very helpfull and smiling. Well located with regrads to transport as there is a underground just around the corner about 3 km from Hfb and 20 min walk to Alexanderplatz. The street where the hotel is has good restaurants, coffeshops and on the corner is a pharmacy in addition Rewe is short walk and also various bakeries.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, but still room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Crossingtheglobe
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was good however improvements could be made in terms on how they handle bookings and their house keeping effort. I stayed here for 3 nights and have specifically requested a double room and a twin room, however by the time we reached the hotel, the front desk advised us that there were no twin room available for that day as they were fully booked (note that we arrived at 9am). I refuse to check-in and hence given the disabled person room which features twin bed and a large undvided bath room. I found this to be extremely unprofessional given that fact that I booked the hotel over 6 months in advance plus I arrived early in the morning to secure my room choice. Location: The location of this hotel is great, it is on the street where most restaurant opens til late. only across the street from a tram stop and subway station. (Subway Oranien-burger Tor) and only 1 station away from the large interchange station of Friedrich Station. It is also within a 10 mins reach by subway to Hackescher Market. Security: The hotel itself seems to be fine, the front door of the hotel will be locked after mid-night and can only be open with your door card. The hotel is located on a street with a noticeable number of prostitutes, but nothing out of the ordinary could be seen from here, just use basic pre cautions. Services: Service in most part are up to standard. Front desk staffs are helpful and motivated, knowledgeable when questions asked regarding local tourist attraction. The down side was I have to physically went down to the front desk when I call and request for extra toilet paper and a set of fork and knife. Rooms, Hotel Facilities and Dinning: The room I had was spacious cause it was intended for wheelchair user, other rooms are just average in size. The bathroom design is also rather stupid in standard room, only the toilet have a door and could be lock, the bath tab is open and with no separation what so ever with the bed. I wasn't aware that there are any type of Facilities in this hotel, but free-wifi is a plus. However hotel wide free wifi is a bit unstable and have very poor signal strength, it is recommended to bring your own LAN cable to use the free internet in your room. This hotel features no restaurant, however they partnered with the restaurant next door to provide breakfast service but it tasted awful. Cleanliness: The cleaning was up to standard, nothing to be complain about. On par with most 3 stars hotel. Will I recommend it? If you get a good deal, than yes. Overall this isn't a bad hotel, but with the price I paid, I expected much more than I have received. There are plenty of other options in the area. explore and you shall find better!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun hotel. Very East Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Smasheduppumpkin
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for my husband and I for our trip to Berlin last December. Our trip was for my husbands birthday and to visit some of the fantastic Christmas markets. The room was nice and spacious. It was good to have some space without feeling like we where falling over each other. The double bed was a little smaller than what we are used to, but then again European beds are sized differently to the uk(think ikea double bed size) no issues with the comfort of the bed. The room had plenty of storage and wardrobe space. The small kitchen area was usefull for making coffee but the lack of pots, plates, cutlery and general cooking utensils made having the kitchen a bit pointless. The bathroom was nice and clean with a good sized bath and a decent shower. Our only dissapointment was the bar was closed during our stay so we never got our 2 free cocktails that where promised at the time of booking. We didn't get the breakfast in a bag so can't comment on that. We just bought some cold meats, bread etc from lidl and made our own. We would get coffee from the little coffee shop next door - great coffee. One of the reasons I choose this hotel was the location. There are loads of bars, cafes and restaurants right outside. It is also a short walk to the Ramones Museum - well worth a visit for music fans (you can walk round the museum with a beer!) When we return to Berlin we would have no issues with booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lack of good parking”
Reviews.Author: DimaEastGermany
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in central Berlin, close to underground station, plenty of cafes and restaurants around to choose from. Staff were very friendly and responded to every request. A perfect choice for weekend getaway! Panoramic windows are great, my little one loved it! Nightlife is very busy around the hotel, great for party-goers. Kunsthaus Tacheles is right next door, also plenty of other attractions within walking distance. On the downside if you are visiting by car street parking is scarce and expensive. However hotel does offer onsite parking for 18 Euro over night. Also no swimming pool/fitness center, something I expected from the 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Emily A
Reviews.Content: Modern and comfortable hotel in central Berlin. Make sure you ask for a room at the rear of the building, though, since the street side could be a bit noisy with all the bars around. The shower design is also unusual- there is no door between the room and the shower / sink area- just a very thin curtain. More appropriate for couples and single travellers than friends travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: garyweston77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in Feb 12 fantastic hotel with really helpful and friendly staff , the nice big windows give you a perfect view , wasn't noisey at all but this was in Feb . Would definitely go back and recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but not sure it´s worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: CannnotSleepOnPlane
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel. Close to U-bahn and walking distance to Friedrichstraße. A lot of cafés and restaurants in the area. The hotel was nice and clean with an unusual room layout with big windows. This could be negative if you have a room on the first 2 floors. Small mini bar but not much to choose from. I was surprised that there where not Wi-Fi in our room. The staff ask me to try the lounge bar hot spot which did not work unless i got out from the room. The beds where quite hard so be aware if you are used to soft beds. A nice thing was that the room had a bathtub. I´m not sure i think this hotel is worth the 4 stars. There might be better alternatives for the same price. Pros: Good location, bathtub, nice and clean and friendly staff. Cons: A little bit to cold in the room. Quite hard beds. No Wi-Fi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city-break hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklebcn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a city break, being walking distance from many places and with excellent public transport connections. The rooms are modern, clean and nicely lit/decorated, the reception helpful, and the bar serves a free breakfast (filled bagels, coffee & fruit) which was perfect for us to grab on our way out somewhere. The rooms at the front look out onto the street - if you are in front but high up this could be nice but on the lower floors you could feel a little exposed (the windows of the rooms are full-wall floor to ceiling, although of course there are drapes) - we didn't mind but I understand the rooms at the back are also quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and well located.”
Reviews.Author: nazza30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days late December and the hotel was excellent. I agree with other TA reviewers in respect of quiet rooms at the rear (courtyard) otherwise you are in full view of all the bars opposite and on the main street. There are lots of bars and restraunts on Oranienburger Strass and also further on is Hackerscher Market and Alexanderplatz which both have good atmosphere at this time of year.The hotel is well located and in walking distance of many of the tourist attractions. It is also 100 metres away from the underground train system. You can buy a ticket for one day for up to 5 people, which covers train, bus and trams that will cover many of the tourist attractions for 15 euros, which I thought was great value. The hotel bar did not seem to be in use at night but this was no problem as you could sit outside at the bars opposite under the heaters and watch the world go by. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a long weekend or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for city break”
Reviews.Author: AnaMargaridaFerreira
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in ArcoTEL Velvet in Berlim in December of 2011 with some friends. I found the hotel nice. The staff always very friendly and helpful. The location was everything for me. Oranienburger Strasse, the street of the hotel, has lots of restaurants and pubs, it's nice for nightlife. There's a lots of public transports nearby on walking distance. The rooms are ok ... not very big but always very clean. The only true downside was the bathroom that was a bit small for me and somehow weird. Mine had the toilet separated from the rest (shower and lavatory). The toilet itself was in a cubicle very claustrophobic while the rest was on a division that had no door all in glass. Nevertheless the two together made a small bathroom. Overall i think this hotel is very good for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe anyone here HAVEN'T HAD the "Frühstückstüte" there...”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: The 4* brakfast comes in a small PAPER BAG. There is a cold sandwich inside, with cheese OR ham, a mandarine and a cereal bar. Coffee is in a paper cup as well, coffee to go... It was SOOOO DISAPPOINTING! It was written only in the SMALL LINES, in the contract. Nothing mentioned in the headline (breakfast included) So, please DON'T BE DECEIVE by them, they don't have a 4* breakfast, they should be ashamed from what they offer. Anyway, staff was nice and room was good. It would be MUCH BETTER NOT to offer any breakfast! Really! Because they don't even have a kitchen. Below check the picture of the 4* breakfast. Betrailers and liers. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/35873976/4stars_Breakfast.JPG

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MohammadFahmy
Reviews.Content: Was in Berlin from 7 to 10 December and being my first trip to Germany, I was a little worried initially as I don't speak German and I wasn't sure if I could get to the hotel on my own. Luckily this hotel was easy to find, being close to both the tram and Oranienburger Tor U-bahn station. The service staff who attended to me were also very friendly and helpful, pointing out the various transport options to the tourist sites I intended to visit in fluent English. The room I was allocated faced the rear courtyard and was quiet throughout my stay. It was of decent size and had a clean, modern design. The bed was comfortable although the pillow was a tad too small for me. Also, I missed having an internet connection and wished that the hotel had WiFi connections. On the whole, I enjoyed my stay here very much and would consider staying here again the next time I visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: Just returned the beginning of December from my first visit to Berlin and found that this 4 star hotel was the perfect location for my 8 day stay. I loved every minute of my trip to Berlin! The hotel is located just around the corner from the Oranienburger Tor U-Bahn station on Friedrichstrasse. That makes it very easy to get from Tegel Airport to the hotel. Since I was traveling by myself I chose a budget room on the third floor (If you like it quiet I recommend a room facing the rear courtyard). The room was immaculate and stayed that way throughout my stay. If you plan to spend a lot of time in your room you might want to upgrade. The hotel staff were all fluent in English and always ready to help in any way. They even helped me with my lousy German. Instead of the breakfast offered in the hotel I elected to eat next door at the Ambulanz Cafe, a real hangout for young Germans. The staff at the Cafe is also fluent in English and for a light breakfast you can't beat it. Across the street from the hotel is the Mirchi restaurant. It serves excellent Singapore and Indo-Thai food at a reasonable cost. This is a hotel and a city that I would definitely return to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - decent location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: travellerSANStourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in this studio. I was satisfied with my stay here. Amenities: Decent with modern design - but missed WiFi. Bed was comfortable but pillow & blanket was small. Room: Small with modern design. They offer rooms facing courtyard and Oranienburger Strasse (with floor to ceiling glass wall). We stayed in outer rooms. Glass wall is not creepy as some said here. Use the curtains when you need privacy. But point to note is shower has no wall so it may sound romantic( or at least no worries) for couples but definitely point to be noted for friends and families. (i don't know about suites). Location: Good - walking to most things. If you want to walk yourself in Berlin I would recommend staying closer to Friedrichstraße station (or south of it) and its prettier. But if you plan to use public transports, Arcotel offers U & S Bahn steps from its door. Service: Reception was on phone when we arrived, kept talking for sometime while we wait (Don't know German so I can't comment on how important that was). But very helpful with suggestions and promptly got us another blanket when we requested for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cridgey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of October. This hotel was great. Very modern, friendly staff and a comfortable room. Breakfast was included and, even though we only made it for one day, it was just enough to see us until lunch. Some great restaurants and bars on Oranienburger Strasse, and was good for exploring the city. Only complaint was on the last day as we were going to get our bags to leave, the key card didn't work (after numerous trips to reception). But the staff, although busy with other guests, were very friendly and helpful. Will definitely look to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Techno bass beats - impossible to sleep”
Reviews.Author: englandboy
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, great location, interesting architecture, small but fun and well-designed rooms - but - the hotel needs to sort out its tedious neighbours. Constant thud-thud-thud until past midnight - I had got up early in the morning on the day of my arrival so was exhausted and needing sleep big time - despite great double-glazed windows which I closed, the thud-thud-thud was still there, permeating everything. The one thing you want from a hotel is to be able to sleep when you want to - Arcotel I'm afraid failed to deliver on this one. I like techno as much as the next guy, but not when I'm trying to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Entertaining...but for all the wrong reasons”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: Myself and business colleagues have previous stayed at the hotel as it is fairly close to one of our clients, and it is reasonably priced. Our recent experience though was pretty terrible. For a start, they allocated me to a smoking room when I'm a non-smoker; the room absolutely stank of cigarettes, yet they were unprepared to move me to another room. The reason? "We're fully booked". Funny that, because when I was later sat in the bar at least 30 more people checked in. In other words, they couldn't be bothered, which seems to be a personality trait required to work at this hotel. The rooms they assigned to my colleagues were equally bad - one ended up on a sofa bed in a room that was clearly part of a suite but had just been locked off to create an available room, another ended up in a room that seemed to be used as a meeting room and just happened to have an adjoining bedroom. I particularly liked my overnight entertainment, some kind of vermin scratching in the roof space above my bathroom. Nice touch. As a company we won't be using this hotel again, that's for sure. Just because you're reasonably cheap doesn't mean you can cut corners when it comes to customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: YD29
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, excellent rooms. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, brilliantly located. A definite full marks if you are looking for a great base, that is located beside great bars and restaurants, easy distance from all main daytime sites. Room was so nice was hard to drag ourselves out into fabulous Berlin..that speaks for itself! Will highly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and the bar tender (Uwe Heine) rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet G
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin and spent 5 nights at this hotel that exceeded all expectations. The rooms are clean and spacious (fast, free wifi a plus) and the location is great but what makes this place special is the staff and Uwe the bar tender. They really took care of us, made us feel at home and helped us fall in love with Berlin. Definitely going back and this is the place I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accommodating staff, fantastic bar tender!”
Reviews.Author: Keagriver
Reviews.Content: Lively neighborhood within walking distance to lots of interesting Berlin sites, or hop on the public transit at the front door -- or even better, rent a bike from the hotel and zip around this fascinating bike-friendly city (OK, the bike rental is more expensive than the place around the corner, but you can't beat the convenience). Comfortable beds (although the mini-pillows were kind of odd -- adequate, but odd); good shower (although the funny tub/shower design resulted in a fair amount of water on the floor, but nothing unmanageable). What we liked the best: the outstanding bar tender, who really knows his cocktails and the interesting ingredients at his disposal. Don't bother springing for the breakfast as there is a great espresso place right next door with free wifi and really nice people. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a kick;-)”
Reviews.Author: Marta D
Reviews.Content: Decent price, great location, no frills, but still functional, modern and clean. The wardrobe in the room could be a bit more spacious. Free apples. Pretty and very courteous reception staff. Didnt have breakfast but can highly recommend a happy hour magic-mixtures made by Uwe - the skillful, helpful and charming Coctail-meister at the cosy lobby bar (with two internet stations for guests' use).

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 130clyde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Liked its modern styling and sense of its own place. Great location and as a new building it looked over an older more architecturally interesting building so had a good feeling of old and new. Room was big enough and very well laid out. Like the sink and curtain wall. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast to go was not great. A icky sandwich and a cup of coffee.Oh and the location was brilant for galleries, cafes, street art, walking ect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - beware of the glass walls”
Reviews.Author: garryparry
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to its quirky presentation (glass walls overlooking the street) and its free internet availability. Was dissatisfied with the latter - couldn't get any connection on the upper floors. In addition, was asked to pay extra for the room which left a bitter after-taste. Breakfast was also OK. Staff were friendly and cheerful. Location was also good. I wouldn't be staying here again though - the shower in the room (literally) affords little privacy and so do the glass walls. I wonder what the residents in the opposite building have to put up with everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: RachM1
Reviews.Content: I booked this place last minute before heading to Berlin for my first time. All I knew is that it had a good review in Lonely Planet and was in the "moderate" price range. The sentence in Lonely Planet wasn't even the tip of the iceberg - this place was FANTASTIC! First of all, it's very difficult to find a room in Berlin for 3 people. Not only did Velvet offer such a thing, they upgraded us to a Junior Suite. We had plenty of space, a kitchenette, bathrobes and even slippers. The rooms are very clean and ultra trendy, yet warm and comfortable. The front desk staff were also very nice (and fluent in English). Another major perk - the hotel is in the middle of EVERYTHING. Within a 15-20 minute walk, you can be at the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, the New Synagogue, the Berlin Cathedral/Museum Island, and more. The subway isn't even a block away! I'd also like to note that on the original reservation, they had wanted to charge an extra 30 Euro per night for the third person. However, when I checked out, they did not include the charge. I don't however think words can do justice for this review. Check out my photos...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_xxoo
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel! Excellent location,beautiful room,staff was fully fluent in English and very happy to assist in any way needed. The bar/lounge attached is great. Definitely would stay here again as well would refer to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Funky cool in the center of Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: BGroovy25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with polite, helpful staff. Located on the oh so cool Oraienburger St. so you'll never be more than a stones throw from cool bars or some of the must see locations. The room we stayed in was well appointed and had really funky decor, we would have nicked the curtains if we could! :) Housekeeping was efficent and unobtrusive. Breakfast was basic but plentyful so no real complaints there. We will be back and will definately consider Arcotels next time we travel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigardanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for using public transit. Our stay was very enjoyable and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be back because the booking was not honoured!!”
Reviews.Author: FORESTFLOWER6
Reviews.Content: Despite booking well in advance of arrival date, upon arrival the booking was not honoured and I was sent to another hotel with a strange sleeping arrangement. A single duvet and a 4 ft bed... cannot recommend such an unreliable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “funny kind of hotel - fits into the surroundings”
Reviews.Author: John_Evans1951
Reviews.Content: - it is located in an alternative area of Berlin - Hotel also kind of strange but not in an annoying way - Breakfast very basic, according to the management they are unable to provide a better breakfast (one bagel max!) due to German law - Main annoyance was that the room phone was not working - it is a cordless phone which apparently doesn't charge unless you are in the room and electricity is on. Apparently it charges within 10 minutes but this wasn't the case for me. An employee brought a replacement phone which was just as bad. Very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and lovely, bright room”
Reviews.Author: HLL81
Reviews.Content: Had a room/suite on top floor of the hotel which had amazing windows giving a fabulous view over the rooftops. Was really peaceful and didn't hear any noise at night. Really great location near public transport and some amazing restaurants. Would highly recommend and will definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are not on a strict budget”
Reviews.Author: Markapuram
Reviews.Content: Nice location in a fantastic city! Tram station right outside the hotel. Friedrichstrasse station a short walk away. Hotel has friendly and really helpful staff. A little expensive as we were just looking for a hotel to just put our bags and sleep the night. There are plenty of other options to stay around this area but we did not want to spend too much time looking around for a deal so this hotel worked out pretty good. Would recommend without hesitation, if you are not a strict budget.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel from which to experience Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Johannfru
Reviews.Content: Part of a three week trip in Europe, I found my 3 days at this hotel to be extremely comfortable, stylish, and accommodating. I had an issue with my bank card ( unrelated to the hotel ) and the staff at the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful. I would absolutely reccommend this hotel to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in the center of east berlin”
Reviews.Author: anschu
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of everything, the best sights in walking distance, if you like to go out at night and like comfort and style - thats your best choice! The hotel at Oranienburger Strasse is surrounded by bars, restaurants, the next tube 50 mtrs. From the next big Trainstation Friedrichstrasse just 7 min walk. The hotelstaff gave us a warm welcome, was helpful and friendly. We had a clean, stylish room with open bathroom (toilette is separate), a comfortable bed and a window to the oranienburger Strasse from ceiling to floor. The only thing I did'nt like was the loud discomusic i could here (only on weekends) at night in our room. But that disturbed only me, my husband slept like a baby. So I think it depends how you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot , quite good for solo travelers and young couples”
Reviews.Author: stiffsurgeon
Reviews.Content: I was in Arcotel Velvet Berlin in February 2011. I stayed there with my wife. The hotel was a nice spot in the middle of Berlin. You can walk through Brandenburger Tor and Reichstag within 20 minutes. The rooms were large enough for 2-3 days of visit. The bed was fit and sleep quality was good. If you had a room facing through Oranienburger Str , you can hear tram voice till late midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern, well located. A great base.”
Reviews.Author: oddjones
Reviews.Content: The arcotel velvet does what it does very well - rooms are modern, well appointed and a reasonable size. Rooms at the front of the hotel benefit from floor-to-ceiling windows over orienenburger strasse so are well worth asking for. There's no restaurant although the hotel serves an included bag lunch of cheese bagels in the bar until 10am. The velvet lounge cocktail bar is not busy, but well stocked and a nice place to unwind. In general the staff are young, knowledgable and very friendly. A great location makes this hotel a great base for exploring the east of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great small modern hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: Perfect little modern hotel with good service, good prices and adequate furnishings (but no toiletries), well located just a couple blocks into east berlin. Everything you need for a very low price. Impeccably clean, welcoming, free wifi in the bar which works on 1st floor rooms, stiff drinks at bar, staff ready to help w/ anything you need, casual informal modern atmosphere. Underground (1 stop to main station) and streetcar right across the street. You can walk to main train about 10 min on Berlin's main Friederichstrasse where you also get the main shopping, nightlife. The hotel area has very busy eclectic dining and nightlife - there is some street noise at closing time but it didn't hinder our sleep. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star standard”
Reviews.Author: Athens24
Reviews.Content: Really great location, good, friendly, helpful staff. Rooms very 'clinical', bare and a bit depressing (and really cold despite having the thermostat up to 30) The 'breakfast' was awful...part of the enjoyment of staying away is to spend time enjoying a sit-down buffet-breakfast. The breakfast offered is a bagel, fruit and cereal bar in a bag!!!! Not value for money at all......... It would be absolutely fine if 1/2 the price due to the location

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly, in an interesting part of the city”
Reviews.Author: eml81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in November 2010, for a visit to the Christmas markets. The room was clean and comfortable, with air conditioning and a heat lamp in the bathroom. Very stylish & contemporary design. One slightly weird thing was the fact that, although the toilet was in a separate, traditional en-suite arrangement, the basin and bath/shower were just behind a net curtain. Fine for us, but perhaps not so good if you're staying with a friend! Maybe the twin rooms would be different. The hotel is a minute's walk from the nearest U-bahn station, and within walking distance of many sights including Museumsinsel, Alexanderplatz and Friedrichstrasse. The surrounding area may not be to everyone's taste (supposedly it's the red light area but we didn't see any evidence of this - just lots of arty, trendy or eccentric sorts) but we liked it - there are also some pretty good bars & restaurants within a few hundred metres of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cool, modern, funky- just like Berlin”
Reviews.Author: WendyM2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an awesome location with both Bahn stations and the tram right out the front door. Fantastic use of space and floor to ceiling windows. It's maybe a bit too modern for grandma but maybe not. Would love to stay here again. Great cocktail bar in the lobby a bonus. Supposed included breakfast isn't anything other than a banana and piece of baguette so that is the only negative. Great coffee shop next door make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky decor - great location”
Reviews.Author: worthingwanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked Arcotel Velvet for our first ever trip to Berlin. Location. Excellent. u-bahn and trams seconds away, and easy transport link from airport. Within easy reach of all the main sights. Although the area had some very weird looking clubs, it felt very safe. Good restaurants in area - particularly liked Nolle under the railway arches. Room - decor was a refreshing change from boring chain hotels. It was nice to have a bath as well as a shower. Only minus was room was at the back, overlooking an open-air night-club, which meant a very noisy Saturday night. Staff - very helpful. Particularily impressed to receive e-mail from manager yesterday in response to my 'comments' feedback form Breakfast - Was served in carrier bags in comfy bar area, with hot and cold drinks available. Contents were a bit hit and miss. 2 croissants one day were lovely, but chicken curry bagel was a bit strange for breakfast. Would definitely stay at an Arcotel again, but probably would choose one in an area with less vibrant nightlife - bit too old for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beccy7844
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for price / location. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is quite funky with floor to ceiling windows and its furnishings, though at breakfast it was clearly popular with all ages and both business men and tourists. It had all you would want for a city break - toiletries, hairdryer, mini bar, tv, wifi in bar. We read reviews and saw mention of noise, so we chose an upper floor. We had a great nights sleep, though we were there tuesday and wednesday night and were not aware of any club's nearby. The downside of the room was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities which was a shame and the tv only had 2 english speaking channels (both news). The breakfast was fine. Bread, yogurt, fruit, cheese, meat, jams, chocolate spread, tea and coffee, fruit juice etc. We were perfectly happy with it. The slight downside though was that it was served in the bar / reception area which was quite small and on both mornings we struggled to get a seat. Reception spoke perfect english and couldn't be more helpful. The security was good, you had to use your key card to ride in the lift. The area is great. Restaurants all around. Tram stop outside and Underground just around the corner. It is perfectly situated for sightseeing with everything in walking distance, though we were exhausted by the end of the day! This hotel would suit all age groups in my opinion. We came in from Schonefeld airport. It is really easy to get to the centre of Berlin from here. Walk out of the front of the airport and ahead and to the left you will see a covered walkway which will take you to the station. Buy a travel card for zones A,B &C. A single ticket is about 2.80 Euros each or a one day card about 6.50 Euros. The train will stop at several stations including Alexanderplatz and Friedrichstrasse. They seemed to run every 20 mins and took about 20 mins. If you get off at Friedrichstrasse and change onto the S2,S25 or S1 it's one stop to Oranienburger Strasse and about a two minute walk to the hotel. A taxi is about 35 Euros and my guide book tells me that there is an airport bus which takes you to Kurfurstenstrasse for around 6.50 Euros. For locaion alone I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Snazzy Design - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bumbletraveller
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of the Arcotel Velvet - largely because for us location is very important. We expected the sights in Berlin would be very spread out - and wanted close access to the Metro, even though normally we'd walk everywhere. The hotel is literally around the corner from Oranienburger Tor metro stop, and it did prove invaluable. The area itself has lots of bars and restaurants - and to find somewhere good, and not hugely expensive we walked no more than about 10-5 minutes. We had good food at Sophien'eck (German), La Oliva (Italian), Mirchi (Curry), Schwarzwaldstuben (German) and Good Time (Thai). The room was a decent size - well equipped, funky design, large shower area. The only gripe I had was that I found the bed hard and I found it quite uncomfortable. We also had to ask for extra pillows as they were not great. An unexpected surprise was that breakfast is inlcuded in any price paid (we'd assumed we were room only). Now, breakfast wasn't amazing - but as far as we were concerned a bonus extra - and the rolls, cheese, pate, fruit, yoghurt, juice, tea and coffee were all fine. A final point on the 'Berlin Card.' We quibbled as to whether to get this or not - at 34 Euros for 5 days / all zones it wasn't cheap. However, if you are going to use it to get to and from the airport - that covers 5 Euro, you only then need to use the metro/tram/bus 4 times a day to make it worth it. Add in the fact that if you buy the ABC zones one you can get to Potsdam (we'd recommend) and that it gets you discount into various attractions it was worth it. We think we probably just got our money's worth - but beyond this, in a city where you WILL use public transport it was so easy to never need change, wait at the machine, validate tickets.

Reviews.Title: “sleeping like an alto”
Reviews.Author: PieterdeN
Reviews.Content: The reception is all too helpful, but can´t help it that at the backside of the hotel there is a market with discotheque for alternative youth. So if you do not belong to such crowd, or have an alternative sleeping rythm yourself, don´t get into this hotel unless you are assured of a frontside room, where the nightlife is boisterous as well, but less loud. The flipside is, that there are nice restaurants (don´t go to opposite Michi- this has nothing to do with Mala-Singapor-Indonesian food) and bars (go to QBA). Well located to catch the U-Bahn etc. 10 minutes walk from Museum Island. Breakfast is sparse.

Reviews.Title: “really nice stylish room but a bit noisy...!”
Reviews.Author: SuperRaptor
Reviews.Content: we got a 3 for 2 deal which gave us an excellent price. the location is excellent, right next to Oranienburger Tor, it takes no time to go to any tourist attraction in Berlin. the room is pretty nice. i quite like the style, especially the glass window and the bathroom design (and the apples everyday!). however, the carpet is actually quite dirty. the carpet is dark red so is pretty hard to noice but once i stepped into the bathroom, i could see the dust straight away. they got a whole trolley of shampoo shower gel and lotion outside the room in the morning but i couldnt find a single one in the room at all...end up using the all in one shower gel + shampoo for 3 days, didnt expect that in a 4* hotel. free internet is avaliable in the room (no wifi, but i borrowed the cable from reception) but it broke down 2 nights out of 3... the reception staff told us there is a 'snack' breakfast in the morning that gave us a little surprise as our package does not include breakfast! since breakfast wasnt included in our package so i had no expectation. althought the breakfast was a bit light but it wasnt bad. the reception staff was really helpful, they dont have a potsdam map, which is understandable anyway but he offered to print us a google map as an alternative! the check in time supposed to be at 3 but we checked in at 11am when we arrived. i would recommond this hotel to everyone except those who need a really quiet sleep. the hotel located in a street that full of bars and clubs (and many good restaurants near by!) it could get quite noisy at night till early in the morning. we were in the 3rd floor but we could hear some music as well as the noice of those who got drunk...it wasnt too bad as we were pretty tired after walking all day and it wasnt that loud but it is something to be considered before booking this place if you need 100% quiet place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and clean in central location in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: MsTripAbout
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Arcotel on a long weekend - clean rooms, good size, good location. Breakfast was a little on the light side for our liking, but plenty of good cafes in the side streets off Orainenburgstrasse made up for that. Good value and well located for walking into Museum Island etc - about 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dermot14
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am a bit mystified by the Stasi Prison comparisons. In my humble opinion the Arcotel is quite cool and not a little quirky. I found the reception and bar staff to be extremely friendly and helpful ( special mention for Suzanne at reception ). Great location too,just north of the city centre. The area is full of great bars and restaurants and right next door to the Kunsthaus Tacheles , an huge art gallery/music venue/club that you really should check out-there is something interesting happening here most nights. My only gripe is the lack of tea/coffee making facilites in rooms , though this seems to be the rule in most continental hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We discovered the ex Stasi Prison turned hotel now known as Arcotel Velvet”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: Because Berlin was filled with a major tourist convention in Berlin this March, hotels were charging outrageous prices for available rooms. As a result we booked what was rated by Trip Advisor reviews as a cool place hip and only 62 on the rating scale of places to stay. Well it was in an up and coming neighborhood but the hotel turned out to be a cheesy version of someone trying to mimic the Hotel W concept. They do not pull it off. Because the hotel is in the former East German side of Berlin, I jokingly referred to it must being a former Stasi (secret police) prison converted to a hotel. So here is the rundown of what to expect if you stay there: 1. Lobby area is small rundown and there is a bar to the right of the entrance to get your lousy free coffee and stale rolls in the morning. I wonder if the same former Stasi prison cook is making those "breakfast included" breads for the guests? What I found funny is that whatever the paid guests don't eat they leave on a tray by the front desk. We came back one night and those miniature door stops were still there. Maybe it was chastise the guests that they did not finish the morning stack of nasty treats? You know how those Germans are on not wasting food. 2. The rooms are small and the fixtures are dorm room style. The carpet is threadbare and in a hideous dark red. I wonder what those Stasi colors were hiding? A lot of dirt I am sure. 3. The bathroom is very small in a dorm room style and oh do not expect the maid to clean the floor. Our bathroom had body hair and muddy foot prints on the tile for the first three days of our stay. 4. The bedding is most definitely left over from some prison or military camp that was long abandoned. Maybe when the Russians left Berlin in the late 80’s? You could feel every spring in the thin mattress and when you moved the bed moves with you. The only thing good about the room is that the internet worked fine without any problems and that the room was quiet. No shouts or screams of torture :) But I saved the best for last. One afternoon we had returned to our hotel/prison room and the light was on indicating we were in the room. (when you enter the room, you place your key card into the slot to turn on power) It also lights up outside your door to let the staff know you are in the room. While we were fully dressed and working in the room, the maid just opened the door and came in. We were quite startled as she did not say a word, did not knock or apologize. But she came in and changed a pillow cover. She then walked out. We were laughing over it. But seriously what if we were undressed or making whoopee? So in conclusion if you want to be in this up and coming area, want the feel of what to me seemed to be a former secret police prison turned hotel then by all means stay here! Just make sure you do not pay much for the room, expect much from the hotel and you really don't mind if the room is shall we say clean by anyone's standard other than maybe a prison maid or a flop house keeper? But in our case we paid a lot of money and got very little. This place is some place I would recommend only as a last resort booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnsley245
Reviews.Content: The hotel is art deco with the bathroom in the bedroom, which is unique. There is a seperate toilet though!!! It is very near the S and U bahn and is an ideal base for exploring Berlin. The hotel is clean and the staff were helpful. There is a TV and DVD player in the room and they are a good size. although you only need to sleep in them as there is so much to do in Berlin. The street they are situated on has plenty of restaurants from all nationalities. There is a lovely pub across the road that does traditional Berlin food and an Indian further down that is very nice and extremely popular. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jvtms910
Reviews.Content: Not very clean, hallways smell like rotten eggs, no room service, terrible area (graffiti everywhere), small rooms!!! Would not send my worst enemy there!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MozartEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a 3 night city break in Berlin in December, staying at the Arcotel Velvet. We were very please with our choice and thought it was great value for money. The hotel was in an excellent location with the tram and UBahn (Oranienburger Tor) just outside/next street. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave us an information pack on arrival. The hotel was very comfortable and stylish with a modern design and fantastic floor to ceiling windows. 2 PCs were in the bar where guests can access the internet free of charge. The breakfast buffet was very generous. The central location of the hotel allowed us to walk into the city centre, but we took the UBahn back after we were exhasuted from a full days sightseeing. Airport transfer: We took the SBahn to and from Schonefield Airport, it took about 1hour with 1 change (Route: UBahn Orienburger Tor to Friedrichstrasse, then changed to SBahn for Schonefield changing at Ostkreuz)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: lemkinn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel in a fantastic location. We stayed 3 nights over New Year's Eve in 2008. The room had great amenities, with a great view of Oranienburger Strasse so we could see the madness from a safe distance. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edandpam
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a fun artsy area of the city. We stayed 4 nights at the Acrotel Velvet during our 3 week trip the Eastern and Central Europe. The Acrotel Velvet is right around the corner from the U-Bahn underground subway (U Oranienburger Tor Stop) and right across the street from the tram stop. We used the highly efficient and easy Berlin BVD Public Transit System to get to the hotel from the airport to get to the train station as we were leaving. There are dozens of restaurants in the immediate proximately to the hotel (five minutes or less walk) and dozens more within a a twenty minute walk in almost any direction. We had great food and good service everywhere we went in Berlin. We found Berlin to be an amazing and welcoming city with incredible history and culture and would be happy to spend more time there. The Acrotel Velvet was a perfect home base location for our daytime sightseeing and evening dining and nightlife. We walked most of the time and also used the U-Bahn and tram to get around with the Berlin Welcome Card which also gave us discounts at some attractions. The hotel public areas and our room was was very modern and nicely decorated. We received excellent service from the desk staff and the bar staff. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the middle of history”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTheHaguearea
Reviews.Content: Till know we stayed three times in Arcotel Velvet situated in the nice Oranienburger strasse with lots of restaurants. Try Mirschi for nice Asian food and take the big breakfast at Orange! The staff is very pleasant and so are the rooms with lots af glass. Take a room in the front so you can see the Oranienburger strasse. U bahn is around the corner and take a sip of wine by Lutner & Wegner. Arcotel is at a hot spot and is a well designed hotel with a good staff

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some problems”
Reviews.Author: msague
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is its location. It's near major sights and close to the subway station. The bus stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel is very beautiful with lovely but very impractical design. The tubs don't have curtains so water comes out when you shower. We had a beautiful enormous sink but you had to stretch far to get your hands under the water. After a couple of days of that your back starts to hurt. The beds were very comfortable. We didn't have breakfast there because at 12 euros per person it was a bit too much and we are not big breakfast eaters, but right next door there's Expresso Ambulanz, where you can have a large capuccino and a freshly made croissant (they are baked there) for about 4.50 Euro. The staff at the Arcotel Velvet was very helpful but they forgot about our wake up call the day we were to depart Berlin and we almost did not make the flight. That is unacceptable. However, I do recommend the hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: bari_ttc
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is a bit overrated recently, the room is nice not nothing special, the bed is not particularly comfortable and the so called ' design' is just trying to make it different with the traditional hotel. I will recommend this hotel to friends if the price can pull down a bit. you may find it surprise when you are the first stay but definitely not the second time.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moky_berlin
Reviews.Content: Amazing room and top service, grat location!!! very very helpful staff and a great selection of vodka!!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin no longer the divided city.”
Reviews.Author: planetearth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arcotel Velvet for 1 week commencing the 5th April 09 . And like all other comments it is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Not far from the local University means that it has a young vibrant population which probably means that it is the most economic place to stay. Unfortunately the loss of value of the UK pound has an effect on how far your money will go. A pint of beer will cost abot 4 to 5 euro and a glass of wine about 4 euro, eating out can also be expensive but there are still places to eat which offer excellent value and serve up fantastic food. Gambrinus across the road from the hotel is probably the only authentic German bar selling quality German cuisine, and that makes it a must visit. If you are lucky enough to get a table a visit at about 7pm should see you get one after that forget it. Also worth a special mention is the Bombay Indian Restaurant next to the theatre on Friedrichstrasse it is probably one of the best Indian meals that I have ever tried and what size portions you will need to be hungry. Imagine visiting Berlin and raving about a curry but I could not write this without meriting it a mention. Belin has plenty places to see and a worthwhile visit is a short 30 min train journey to see the Olympic Stadium which was very historic but in many was very modern. The down side was a visit to Check Point Charlie Museum which was a rip off 12.5 euro entrance fee per person it is poorely presented,disorganised and claustrophoboic just as described in many best book reviews. Many of the museums including this one are entrance free after 16:00 so check before you go. A humbling visit to to the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe and to the nearby Documentation Museum are free of charge but please leave a donation at the exit for the upkeep of the Museum it is the least the memory of the Holocaust deserves. You will exit with a lump in your throat it is depressing but a story that has to be told and remembered. On a lighter note you will love the place and certainly one of the top cities to visit in europe if not the world.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for the funky side of Berlin? This is it!”
Reviews.Author: Maree-Kevin
Reviews.Content: It's 10 years since we were last in Berlin, and I suppose I was a bit worried that the place might have changed beyond all recognition - caught up in the homogeny that seems to be taking over the world. Happily that wasn't the case, and the Arcotel Velvet is living proof of that. We stayed 4 nights. Firstly, the location is fab - literally a 1-minute walk from the Orianienburger Tor U-Bahn station (which is the line that comes from Tegel Airport), and a couple of minutes' walk from the Orianienburger Strasse S-Bahn (only 2 stops from Unter den Linden - ie. the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag). Right outside the door is one of the tram lines and there are buses around the corner on Friedrichstrasse. Orianenburgerstrasse is typical Berlin, and the way I remembered it - cool glass and steel modern buildings cheek-by-jowl with crumbling stone buildings covered in graffiti and often serving as contemporary art spaces. There are fantastic cafes and eateries all along the street - Thai, Italian, Indian (warning: if you want 'proper' Indian food you need to tell your waiter. Otherwise you get bland, spice-bereft, creamy Indian food designed for the German palate). We are vegetarians and all the restaurants had a good selection of vegetarian options - much better than here in the UK. It's about a 30-minute walk to Alexanderplatz and the Fernsehturm, if you don't want to take public transport, and on the way you can explore the fabulous art nouveau courtyards of Hackesche Hoefe. A pleasant discovery was that The Ramones Museum was just up the street and around the corner. I knew about the Museum but it was a real bonus that it was so close to our hotel. The view from some of the rooms at Arcotel Velvet can be disconcerting if you're not expecting it; we had a standard queen room at the back of the hotel, and our windows looked out to - well, there's no other way to put it - a junkyard! But that's all part of the Berlin experience. Our room was funky, modern, comfortable, clean - with nice bed linen and towels etc. The staff are unbelievably nice and although I speak some German they were happy to switch to English when I apologised in German that my language skills were not fabulous, or whenever my partner spoke to them in English. We booked in a couple of hours before check-in and left our luggage. When we returned the bags had already been taken up to our room. I had the best Bloody Mary of my life in the Velvet Lounge (the bar at the main entrance to the hotel), though it was pretty pricey. The buffet breakfast was included in our room rate and was very nice indeed, but we wouldn't have eaten there if we had to pay the €16 per head price - ouch! There are plenty of places up and down the street where you can get a croissant and coffee, or the typical northern European breakfast of bread, cheese/cold meats and coffee, for €3-7. The are only two elements that might be seen as negative by some. The first is the fact that there are a couple of nightclubs nearby and Berlin is a late-night kind of place. We are beyond the clubbing age and we were conscious of some music and revelry at various times through the night - but mainly because we are fresh-air people and always sleep with a window open. If you had the window closed I doubt you would be affected... and anyway, that kind of noise sort of fits with Berlin. It was a happy reminder of where we were, and a change of pace of us having lived in the peaceful Surrey countryside for 18 months. The other issue - again, something that simply added 'local colour' for us - is that Oranienburgerstrasse is known for having sex-workers touting for business at night. We were perfectly comfortable passing by - the girls are well-dressed (not lots of flesh on display), look like they're over 18 years old and don't appear to be affected by mind-altering substances. They clearly know their potential customers - we weren't approached and didn't feel in any way intimidated. All in all, we highly recommend the Arcotel Velvet if you're looking for accommodation in the mid-range price bracket, and hoping to see the 'real' Berlin. Great location, funky decor, wonderful staff and we thought it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price, in a great location....”
Reviews.Author: RaspberryTigerUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Arcotel Velvet. The hotel in a great location in the old eastern side of Berlin - you can literally walk to most major sites within 10/15 minutes or jump on the S/U Bahn, which we found easy and very safe to use - the nearest stop is about 30 yards away. We purchased a 'Welcome Card' for 72 hours for zones A, B & C (purchased at the airport), which we used to get us all over the city and also to take us as far as Potsdam. Our room was cleaned daily and was immaculate. We were placed on the 2nd floor, facing Oraneinburger Strasse, which was great, however I would suggest requesting a room a few floors higher to avoid street noise, especially in the summer when you would possibly want the window open; there are also rather a lot of nightclubs nearby, so could get quite noisy in the middle of the night. Breakast - we pre-booked it for two mornings and by pre-booking it, we saved 6 euros each, which made it worth while, as otherwise it is expensive for what is on offer. Dinner - we found a great italian restaurant just across the road, very small and quaint and the food was delicious! We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our 3 week trip!”
Reviews.Author: canyonlady
Reviews.Content: First off, Berlin was a revelation. We did not stay long enough, and when we do go back, we will stay here. The room rates were great, even with unfavorable exchange rates back then. They gave us a double room adjacent to, and connected by door, with our son's single room. Floor to ceiling windows, great views. The 'shades' were remote control (they started up in the middle of the night, hello!). The hotel is convenient to public transit, they have a wacky parking garage (your car is put at some level, on a carousel). Restaurants nearby, easy access to all. Convenient. Clean and very affordable. Cheapest rooms of our entire trip, and no sacrifice on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Velvet over New Year 08/09 and it cost £70 per night, booking with the hotel's website. Finding the hotel was very easy - the nearest S-Bahn station is a very short walk away. Upon arrival I was impressed at the modern look and feel of the Velvet and the reception was pleasing. We were allocated a street facing room on the sixth floor so had the benefit of a floor to ceiling window - the views are great! I was a little disappointed with the room - the quality was excellent - but our bed was nothing more than a pull out sofa type and our room was 601.1 which had an adjoining door so I suspect that when the hotel isn't full, they treat our room as 601's sitting area to make 601 a Suite-type room. We also didn't experience the middle-of-room shower! Having said the above, it is a nice hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to return. Wireless Internet is free in public areas and Cabled Internet is chargeable in the room - I think it's 12 Euro a day. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, so I cannot comment on catering standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DancingEmpress
Reviews.Content: We picked this based on guidebook reviews and looking at the website, and it initially looked like the best for the price. We ended up feeling like it was a true hotel steal! The room was spacious, comfortable, and very has good heating which is important in the winter! It is very conveniently located, a nice walk to most of our destinations, and an incredibly easy walk to public transportation if the destination is too far. We didn't eat at the pricey buffet, but the instead used the coffee shop next door. There is also a small organic grocery store nearby, in addition to many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lively”
Reviews.Author: CR5
Reviews.Content: Arrived in a deluge of rain and was a little disappointed to have a room overlooking a courtyard rather than the Oranienburger Strasse. However, it was a decent room. Satellite TV/DVD player and great furnishings including an enormous wet room/shower albeit in the middle of the room. But hey thats why you stay here- for something different! In a lively area of town and brilliant for getting around. We did it all on foot bar the bus TXL to and from the airport. The hotel is placed at the top end of the the street near Oranienburger Tor and is very very close to the U Bahn. Didnt bother with a 15 Euro breakfast but went down Friedrich Strasse (or something like that!!) and picked up a coffee, cake and roll for undfer 7 Euro for the 2 of us. There is a great pizzeria next to the hotel with enormous pizzas at great value. If I go again I would definitely stay in this area of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, nice design”
Reviews.Author: kfryd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by TripAdvisor as a one of the top bargain deals in Europe and Arcotel fully deserves it. Only 5 minutes walk to the Hackescher Markt area and to the Friedrishstrasse but you really don't need to go anywhere if you look for good spots in Berlin. Probably the best hotel deal I've ever made.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoAversa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights on July. Really nice room with giant windows and a tastefully decoration (exactly like the website picts) . The staff is friendly . Hotel location is the best, with a lot of restaurants ,cafes and attractions in a walking distance. The breakfast is a little pricey but you can have it for half price at the nice cafe right next door. A real boutique hotel. I strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Boutique / modern style - reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Moscow_traveller
Reviews.Content: Once again Trip Advisor helped us pick this hotel. Overall it did what we wanted, a modern boutique style hotel in Berlin at a reasonable price. The bathrooms were a little strange being part of the room separated by a net curtain, (so go with someone you are friendly with..) The bed was comfortable. FYI - the in room DVD player is hidden in the furniutre and the Infra Red could not see the front of the DYD player.. - hence you have to get out of bed to switch it off / change scenes / use the menu! Location is fine, about 20 minute walk to the Brandenburg gate. There are lots of restaurants in the area. We were there during the transport strike and got round everywhere by mainly our feet and the odd taxi and everything was easily reached which we wanted to do. Only bizarre thing is the internet access. In the rooms it is with a wire and wireless in the lobby. If you want a 24 hour pass, you have to decide on the wire or the wireless, so, its not possible to switch between the two locations (sometimes useful when my fionce wants to sleep in the morning. and I have insomnia....). However, this was quite easily solved by finding the coffeee shop next door (walk out of the hotel and turn left) which has free WIFI, power sockets and a great cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: IPool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 nights at the Arcotel Velvet in Berlin this past July. The hotel was GREAT! Fantastic location, walking distance to great shopping, museums, bars and all kinds of restaurants right on our doorstep. We didn't eat at the Austrian restaurant downstairs, a bit pricey especially since we're veg., but many vegetarian options (falafels, italian, asian) just steps from the hotel. We stayed in a suite on the top floor of the hotel. Very reasonably priced, spacious and clean. Great views of the Berlin rooftops out our front windows and funky views of the graffiti clad club out our back door. Hotel staff was very pleasan, helpful and unpretentious. Definitely one of our best hotel experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of memories”
Reviews.Author: MareAlexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last spring based on positive reviews from Trip Advisor. This will add to those positive reviews. The hotel room is very comfortable and very modern chic - you have to like bold colors to stay here. The bed was cozy and there was a large plasma screen tv. I loved the floor to ceiling windows; we had a view of the street and thought it interesting to watch people come and go. Our room was on the third floor so we didn't have any problem with noise from the street. The toilet and shower are separate from the room but there is no door for privacy. This wasn't a big deal for us. However, the sink was a strange size - it was unusually large and, being short, I had a difficult time reaching the faucet handles. I thought the corridor from the elevator to the rooms was too dark but I guess this was part of the whole "mod" look. We didn't go to the bar since there was too much cigarette smoke for my comfort (the lobby which is right off the bar also smelled smokey). We did try the breakfast buffet downstairs, which was delicious though a bit pricey. Other days we just walked down the street to a cafe and had coffee and pastries. We liked the location of the hotel which was close to the museums and the subway. It's a great hotel for couples or singles; not for families. We would definitely stay here again if we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireNic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 7 nights in August. All staff were very friendly. The room was immaculate and decorated in a modern yet comfortable style. Rooms have air conditioning and external blackout blinds were good touches. The room had a large shower with a glass door which was within a curtained room, which also housed a large sink. The toilet was in a separate room from the bedroom and shower area. At first I thought having the shower in the main room would lack privacy, but actually it was fine. The hotel is located on a street with a lot of excellent bars and restaurants. The U and S bahn stops are only 1 minute walk from the hotel and the tram stops directly oppsite the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location for visiting many of the sights Berlin has to offer. The hotel is also secure with a digital safe in the room and to get access to the rooms you have to use your room card to activate the lift. Although I should mention that this is a very safe and friendly are. I would definately recommend this hotel and I am in fact planning on booking another holiday here soon!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel in red”
Reviews.Author: TurfShanghai
Reviews.Content: Arcotel enjoys a great location. The hotel is located in the Mitte area and is connected by both U Bahn and S Bahn subway lines. The first night we were checked in a room at the back of the building which wasn't ideal, as there's a bar/disco downstairs that will keep you awake all night. In fairness, this room has a nice terrace which is shared by guests of the rooms next to us, which we liked but we couldn't stand the noise. So we requested to move to one of the rooms at the front the next morning. The hotel staff was nice and professional, and they delivered what they promised. This room facing the front with a better view is bigger and has a nicer shower. The Lounge at the hotel has a cool cocktail selection, worth a try if you stay there. It was overall a pleasant experience. A cool place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: TKgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect location. The noise from the street is ok, we didn't lose any sleep over it. The design aspect can mostly be found in the rooms, there are many nice little details that are worth checking out. The hotel personnel is young but knowledgable and helpful. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Alsterhai
Reviews.Content: With respect to all the reviews on tripadvisor I decided to book the hotel as well. And I wasn't disappointed; far from it! The Arcotel is best located on the popular Street "Oranienburger Straße", the subway "Friedrichstraße" is nearby, the rooms are extreme tasteful decorated and stylish and the staff is polite and helpful. Before you book check the design of the Hotel - if you like it do not hesitate to save your stay in this breathtaking hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, distinctive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feline_Fine
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here last weekend and loved the hotel. Arcotel is in the perfect location - walking distance to the tourist sights and shops, and right on the main street for bars and restaurants, so no need to walk far or use public transport at night. 30 seconds walk to the U-Bahn if you don't enjoy walking. The rooms were lovely, comfortable bed, good facilities and very clean. Mini bar was overpriced though but aren't they always! The staff were friendly although our rooms weren't ready when we arrived mid afternoon. Didn't use the restaurant or the bar - far more interesting/cheap places and a great deal of variety as you make your way up the street. Have dinner and cocktails in the Singapore restaurant across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Arcotel Velvet: Great Hotel Stellar Location”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful, knowledgeable staff who gave us excellent recommendations. Well appointed rooms, very large for the money by European standards. Highly recommended for travelers under 35 looking to explore Berlin's nightlife. Fantastic location near plenty of restaurants and nightlife, with good access to transit to explore the rest of Berlin. Street noise can be loud, so if you plan to go to bed early, request a room facing the back. The restaurant serves an ample all you can eat buffet (including champagne), but at 15 Euros per person is a pricey option, and can be easily skipped given all the great places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “style and location”
Reviews.Author: greggoak
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great value. The combination of style, location and price can't be beat. The giant windows are great (and don't worry, the street-side rooms are quiet), the rooms look exactly like they do on the hotel Web site (minimalist chic), and the location is in the heart of one of the most interesting parts of Berlin, and a short walk to many of the major museums and sites. The street the hotel is on is a bit touristy, but walk a few blocks in either direction and you get away from that. This definitely felt like a hotel for younger people, but probably not great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience at the Velvet”
Reviews.Author: RufusTFirefly
Reviews.Content: Two couples spent 3 nights at the Velvet in late November. It's unique, interesting, and comfortable. Felt special staying there. Good location with public transportation at the door. Lots of nice restaurants and bars in the area--all sorts of ethnic restaurants as well as a variety of traditional German places. Easy walk to the Museum Island and many other sights. Staff members were very helpful to us in everything from good dining recommendations, to providing directions and travel tips, to printing out our airline bording passes for us the night before our flight home. We aren't big breakfast eaters, so we got our breakfasts at a little place next door that had pastries, cereal, coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great loaction”
Reviews.Author: woodymark2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel in September 2007 and couldn't have picked a better hotel if we'd tried. We booked a suite (more of an apartment) on the top floor, which was great value compared to other cities. The suite was spotlessly clean, had 4 rooms with great views and a very comfy bed. We didn't have the breakfast, as we had read it was very expensive, but there was no shortage of places to eat on Oranienburger Strasse, so no problem there. Also, don't get too concerned about the 'Working Girl's', they don't bother anyone (who doesn't want to be). Also, the post atomic looking hippy centre (I can't remember the name sorry), is definatly worth a look. We were initially put off but went in on our last night and realised we'd almost missed out on a bit of gem. Myself and my partner are in our thirties, so were aprehensive about the hotel and area possibly being too young for us. But on the contry, we found it to be a bit of something for everyone. The only bad point I can think of is on occasion the staff, while friendly, were lacking in customer service experience. When we were leaving, we were not informed that our cab had arrived (even though they booked it), eventually the cab driver asked us while sat in reception if we were his customer (luckily my German is good). Also, whenever we went to the bar, the barman was always trying to push us to buy cocktails, when the majority of the time, all we wanted was a beer. But these were very minor gripes compared to the overall experience, which was very enjoyable. I definately recommend the Arcotel Velvet and Berlin, a great hotel and fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Funky new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paupy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend and we really liked it.Room was extremely clean and we actually got what we requested - one that was far away from the elevator shaft - which is rare. We got a room facing the street at the front of the hotel but weren't bothered by noise at all. We struggled to get the blinds closed completely but given that we were in Berlin over a grey, wintery weekend there was no problem with light. Really liked the open plan bathroom, although my husband noticed that the shower was prone to sudden short, sharp increases in temperature - he tends to take hotter showers than I do, so beware of that if you're partial to parboiling yourself too. We took breakfast in the hotel each day - no doubt we could have found cheaper options in one of the cafes outside, but we noticed that most of these came with the cold meats and cheese that characterise German breakfasts which we don't eat, so taking advantage of the hotel buffet each morning was a much better option for us. You have the option to help yourself to champagne too if boozing at breakfast is your thing. Our only gripes with the hotel was that we had two small single duvets rather than one large one and the pillows were so flat and tiny that we woke up with sore necks - my husband's remained painful for a week afterwards. However, the receptionist took the time to ask us about this when we checked out which I thought was good. Watch out for the hotel bar prices - beers here were 6 euro compared to 3 euro outside. Overall I would recommend this place and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JaseK
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a very vibrant and upcoming location. A few ladies of the night around after dark but this only adds to the character of the place. We stayed in a top floor suite and the decor was sparse but functional and the windows with fantastic views and blackout blinds were great. Overall a fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place”
Reviews.Author: xxrrttyy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Velvet for two nights recently, and was extremely happy with this hotel. Service was first-rate, room was nice, clean and modern, breakfast buffet outstanding, location ideal. The only things I would comment on that were not 100% positive were: if you opened the window in my room (which was in an easterly direction) you could hear music from a night club down the street, a bit annoying. But being October I didn't have the window open much. The other thing (very minor) was that when you check in, you're provided with two cards: one is a key card, the other you insert into the wall to turn on the power supply of your room. This is very modern and certainly energy-efficient, which I applaud. But we were not told of this when we checked in, and being less than techno-savvy, there were a few annoying minutes when we tried to figure out how the hell to turn on the power! That being said, there are many excellent reasons to stay at the Velvet. The front desk staff was extraordinarily helpful, meeting every need promptly and more. Certainly they provided better service than most. The room was exactly as advertised (no nasty surprises): very clean & well kept, beds comfortable, bathroom facilities very good. We debated whether to take the breakfast buffet, since it was 12 Euros and not included with the room. However, it was entirely worth it, especially if you're hungry. A really first-class breakfast. The location on Oranienburgstrasse is very convenient also. There's an U-Bahn station literally around the corner, and an S-Bahn station about 2 minutes walk. There are also a multitude of restaurants in the neighborhood, just about anything your palate desires. As an aside, Several blocks down is the Yi Spa, where they give an absolutely incredible massage. For those with physical problems or just wanting to relieve some stress, Yi Spa gave me the best massage I have ever had (out of about 500+ I have had). The front desk staff set this up for me. I enthusiastically recommend the Velvet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aMid-aSmi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Long weekend in Berlin, staying at the Arcotel. Really nice hotel with very comfortable trendy style rooms ideal. If you're planning to be out and about all day sightseeing, then this place is ideal, excellent location and most of the sites are 30 min walk away and there is a tram stop right outside and tube 100m away. Plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs around the hotel of all styles, no need to wander more than 15 mins of the hotel to find something you'll like. Found wandering back to the hotel bar after dinner was good way to finish the evening as the cocktails they serve are really good and the bar is nice place to unwind in. Other than the nice rooms and good bar, hotel doesn't offer many facilities, breakfast will set you back 15 euro pp and it's ok if you can't be bothered to go out and find somewhere. One word of warning. If you come out of the hotel late in the evening and turn right, after about 20m or so you will start to come across 'ladies of the night' standing around. Whilst it is a warning, don't be put off as that's the main direction of the bars and restaurants. Unless you are single or group of guy(s), then you'll have no hassle at all, otherwise you may have to say 'No' - a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelight33
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the Mitte area of Berlin. Very close to several U Bann Stations. Rooms were clean, good sized and well decorated with modern decor. There is a Flat Screen TV with DVD player - so be sure to bring some CD's if you are staying - we forgot! Rooms were quiet given the busy street outside, The only thing that could have been included was breakfast - which there was a charge of 12 Euro per person for. If you walk outside the hotel there are plenty of eating placed closeby. The Indian place directly across the road was really nice for dinner and drinks - There are also a few italian's nearby. All in all a really nice 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: SelinaE
Reviews.Content: Decided to booked this hotel on our recent trip to Berlin based on the reviews given from Tripadvisor members and we were not disappointed. The location was just great and the hotel was new, trendy and it was a refreshing change from the standard hotel chains which we would usually stay in. The staff was friendly and efficient. We have requested for a late check out and was quickly obliged. Just outside the hotel are many restaurants. One in particular which we went to was a Cuban restaurant called QBA.
