The food was good, great cocktails and live Cuban music too. The place had a great atmosphere and was very reasonably priced. Both hotel and restaurant comes highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for youg people”
Reviews.Author: osk77
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Oranienburger strasse is definitely a cool are of the city and this hotel fits with that personality. I would just say that this is a choice for younger-crowds, the hotel is located in a party area. A bit of noise during the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterTartanLad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Greeted by friendly and efficient staff. Excellent room although probably not everyones taste. Comfy bed. Situated on Orianburger Strasse with many great Bars and Restaurants in easy walking distance. Most sites on east side of Berlin easily accessible even on foot, although S Bahn,U Bahn and Tram stop all within yards. Excellent bar, apparently one of the top 5 in Berlin which is a fair boast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: jft678
Reviews.Content: First impressions were of a really nice hotel, in a great location, with pleasant, helpful staff. We had asked for a quiet room and were pleased to be allocated one at the back, given that the hotel is on a busy street. Unfortunately the noise from the surrounding bars and clubs kept us awake all three nights we were there, well into the early hours. One night, at 2am, it was so bad I had to take the mattress off my bed and drag it to the small corridor by the bathroom to get some respite. A great shame as otherwise the hotel is good value for money and I would have been very happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Delaware012
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Arcotel and had a wonderful time. What a fun hotel! The hotel has an unusual design and great floorplan. We were looking for a hotel that reflected the international travel, yet provided a spacious and comfortable living area. We stayed in a suite and had more room than we needed. The floor to ceiling windows were fabulous and gave a great view of the area. When needed, there were shutters and blinds you could use to afford privacy. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Checkin and checkout were efficient. Our only complaints were that the bed was a bit hard and the pillows were lumpy and not great. However, we would stay here again in a heartbeat. The hotel is in a great location - near the U-bahn and S-bahn. There are great restaurants right across the street. We felt perfectly safe and did not find the night life uncomfortable. If you are looking for a "funky" hotel with lots of personality, then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its unique rooms and great location and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants and really great shops nearby - no chains in sight!! The other great benefit of this place was its proximity to the main sights and public transport. Many reviews have commented on the fact that the bathroom is not walled off from the room but I loved it - it's something different from the stock standard hotel room!! There is a curtain which acts as a wall, and in our room, the shower was in a corner so I couldn't see my hubby having a shower anyway. The toilet is completely separated which is the most important issue - after all, that would be way too much information!!! The welcome pack with information on Berlin was really handy and very welcoming. One thing I did find a little unusual was that the toiletries weren't replenished on a daily basis - not sure why but it didn't bother us as we'd collected more than enough little shampoos and soaps on our travels to last a long time! Free internet access was great as well to check your emails. My only word of advice is not to bother with the bar downstairs - we found that drinks were pretty cheap in Berlin with lots of choice, but the Arcotel's drink prices were not competitive, so we gave the bar a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: dopee36
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel and right in the middle of everything. It's very modern. The shower and sink were in the room, separated by a curtain and the toilet was in a separate room. Our room looked onto the street which was hopping even at 4am. It's a little odd that anyone walking down the hall could find out if you were in the room or not (room numbers are lit in red or green) All in all, it's a very nice hotel, but I don't know if I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: maturecouple60plus
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day trip to Berlin. This hotel was 1st class. The rooms were really nice. We had a quite room with a conventional bathroom. It is very close to the Uban and the Sban which made it really easy to travel around. A really good place to eat was just on the corner from the Sban underground. We ate there morning and evening and the staff were great. Turn right when you leave the hotel and walk to the Sban underground. If you really want to shop you should stay near the main shopping area. The KaDaWe is like Harrods.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a fantastic location. The hotel decoration is diferent and the location fantastic, if i return to Berlin I will stay here again. Surrounded by a lot of good restaurants, the only con, perhaps, the breakfast, a little bit expensive Really nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hipster paradise and the best hotel of the trip by far.”
Reviews.Author: cityscaped
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Berlin rather suddenly and had one night to find a room -- the Arcotel was one of a very few places in my price range that had both availability and a location in Mitte. Despite some of the reviews (particularly with regard to the bathrooms), I said, as others have, 'Screw it, it's Berlin,' and booked a room. Upon arriving, I knew I'd made the right choice -- despite showing up as a backpacker (enormous rucksack, exhausted look, clothes and hair a mess, that lovely train smell), I was greeted as though I was someone's long lost sister and as though my arrival had saved the day. I was checked in instantly, treated with respect and friendliness (not always the case, given my age and the backpack) ('How was the trip?' etc.), and given a room on the fourth floor with a stunning view of the street. I was surprised that I had such a great view since I'd booked via hotels.com. The room was surprisingly spacious -- queen size bed, generous desk, plenty of bathroom space, a chair, and a wardrobe, and I never found myself tripping over things or felt crowded. As a bonus, the bathtub in the room was enormous and quite deep; I took several baths during my stay, as the tub was just that good (and the shower gel provided smells delicious). It was well decked out -- leather trimmings, black and red, plenty of punchy personality -- to the point where I felt a bit too uncool to be staying there. There are a lot of 'little things' that take a bit of getting used to. While the room does have blackout curtains, with floor to ceiling windows that's a bit of an impossibility to begin with, but the curtains are also divided into three panels, meaning there are always a few small gaps through which light comes in. If you are absolutely insistent that there be no light whatsoever, then, yes, you will find that a problem (so bring an eye mask or stay somewhere else). As others have mentioned, the open(ed) bathroom gives more space and dimension to the room, but it could be a bit awkward if you're not on good terms with your roommate. If you're alone, however, it's great, as you can pull back the curtains and have a clear view of the TV while in the tub. Another note: this is not, I'll admit, a family friendly hotel; unless you've discussed the facts of life with your children, the 'male pill' condom pack might be a bit awkward, and it isn't hidden. On the other hand, I can't imagine a more perfect place for a hipster couple to spend a romantic weekend, so take that as you will. The hotel as a definite personality -- young, cool, etc. -- and if that appeals to you, this is the place for you. If you're looking for a quiet, cozy place to retire to after a long day of sightseeing, you might be better off booking somewhere else. But for adults... it's hard to beat. The bar downstairs, while expensive, is fantastic, and the bartender will give good recommendations if you ask (and he's quite funny as well, if you like caustic). The prostitutes are out on the street, yes, but they're completely nonaggressive and harmless; I didn't encounter any drug dealers, so I can't speak to that. Despite being a young woman alone, I didn't feel at all uncomfortable wandering around the streets at 2AM, even while slightly tipsy (and sometimes more than that). The location is excellent -- there's always something going on the moment you step outside (although you don't hear it, thank God, once you're in your room), plenty of restaurants (expensive and not), bars, clubs, stores, etc. As far as internet access is concerned, there's a great cafe with free wireless literally next door to the hotel and an internet cafe near the S-Bahn stop -- you really don't need to get away from the hotel to find what you need. But if you'd like to see more of Berlin, there's a U-Bahn station literally around the corner and an S-Bahn station a two minute walk away. (If coming from the train station: change to the U-Bahn; that exit is closer to the hotel than the S-Bahn and you will see the hotel as soon as you turn onto the street.) The hotel staff were incredibly professional and helpful -- they found me a laundromat nearby and gave me instructions when I asked. Only two minor hang ups: I decided to extend my stay by one night and was charged the full price for that night (or double what I paid on hotels.com); I should have checked to see what the rate was when I made that agreement, so that was rather foolish. As for the other: a bottle of hairspray went missing from my room; I choose to think someone on the housekeeping staff picked it up and forgot to put it back down (as I frequently returned to my room to find that housekeeping had arranged my toiletries more artistically), as ... who steals hairspray? Really. As this happened on my last night and I left early, I never recovered it, although the hotel staff did say they'd look into it for me (but, again, given the time of the disappearance and my train the next morning, it was futile and I knew it). Nothing else ever went missing from my room and my bags appeared untouched the entire time, so I find it amusing rather than a theft. If you are concerned about that, there's an in room safe -- it was actually large enough to hold my seventeen inch laptop: a truly unexpected (and far too welcome) surprise. I knew as soon as I arrived in Berlin that I was coming back; when I do, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: evnyc1
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. We loved the location. The staff and the room where also great. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Berlin has a great vibe and its worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Truzular
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a four night stay in this hotel and were more than impressed with both Berlin itself and the level of service we recieved in the Arcotel Velvet. The hotel itself is in an excellent location and can be found very easily from the Orienburger Tor stop. We found the staff more than helpful and extremely friendly. My boyfriend ripped his jacket, they took it away to get repaired and it was fixed and in our room the following day. They also made a huge effort when we asked them for the best place to hire bikes and came back with an address and full directions in a matter of minutes. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are wonderful with fabulous views of Orienburger Strasse. Although half the room is window and the hotel is located on a main street and next to a nightclub, we heard very little noise unless the window was open. Mitte itself (in our opinion) is the place to stay, it's a very central location for all the main sights with an artistic, bohemian and very relaxed feel, there are literally hundreds of bars, cafes and resturants to choose from right on your doorstep. Don't let other reviews talking about drug dealers and prostitutes put you off. We didn't encounter one person selling drugs and although prostitutes are out on the streets at night, they are definately not in your face. It's not a seedy or intimidating area and the streets are as much filled with young families, couples and old peple as they are with ladies of the night! To be honest, it's more fascinating and a bit sad rather than scary or seedy. Things to do: Hiring bicycles, if you can, cannot be recommended enough. It's such a good way to see a large part of the city. Get a good map and get out there and join the hoards of locals on their bikes. The museum at Checkpoint Charlie is worth a vist, it's a bit run down but packed to the rafters with information about the turbulent history of Berlin. Try the singapore resturant right opposite the hotel. It's usually pretty busy after 7pm but the food is excellent and the staff are really nice and friendly. It stays open to about 3am on the weekends too. There is a venue right next door to the hotel (on the right as you come out the door). It's a lively wee outdoor place with great music and a kind of festival feel. It seems to stay open all night on a Saturday night as we got up to catch our flight on sunday morning and it was still going. If anyone still feels young enough, it seems to be the place to go! Have a look around Auguststrasse area. There's a corner of about three or four bars and resturants and it's really bustling and relaxed. The resturants serve people outdoors and there are some people playing guitars on the streets, it's a really nice area to eat. If your a coffee fan, go to the Espresso Ambulanze next door to the hotel (on the left as you come out). The guy in there is really lovely and he serves a great cappuccino Overall, we found Berlin to be an excellent place to visit for a few days and I cannot fault the hotel in any way. The location too was top class...great stay! Can I just finally give a warning to anyone flying with the COWBOY airline RYANAIR!! We thought we were doing a good thing by putting our luggage into one bag and checking only one item in. The 'computer-says-no' robot-lady at the desk informed us we would be charged €104 as our one bag was overweight, even though our stuff would not have been overweight if we had two bags to check in. THIS IS RYANAIR'S WAY OF GETTING THOUSANDS AND THOUSANDS OF POUNDS OUT OF PEOPLE...DO NOT LET THEM GET AWAY WITH IT ANY MORE!!! Be careful, if there are two of you going, take two bags and check them both in...practically every other person in our queue was being sent off to pay something towards Ryanair, they're a bunch of cowboys! Anyway, amen and have a great time in Berlin..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caleb1111
Reviews.Content: I shared a junior suite with 2 friends on the 6th floor facing out onto Oranienburger Strasse. Amazing view through the enormous slanted windows. A spectacular room. I would have to say this was the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. The room featured a breakfast table and also a lounge area, flat screen tv, dvd player and a choice of cds. The double bed had individual duvets and was quite large so it felt like separate beds. The person on the sofa bed was also very satisfied. Loads of space within the room and plenty of cupboard space too. The kitchen has a kettle, fridge and hob. Impeccably clean. Bathroom very satisfactory. In the junior suite the bathroom was separate to the room, as opposed to a queen room where the bath/shower (although screened) was open plan. I viewed a queen room which was very impressive too. Initially we chose not to have breakfast in the hotel as it seemed pricey. However, after 2 successive mornings of wandering around the locality in search of a menu to satisfy everyone's needs I would recommend the hotel buffet breakfast. It was superb. I am a vegetarian and generally suffer when it comes to European buffets, but there was plenty of choice beyond the typical meat options. The cereals & muesli accompanied by a variety of seeds and yogurt were divine. Plenty of fresh breads, pastries and good coffee make it worthwhile. If you book the breakfast the night before you can avail of the reduced rate at 12 euro. The staff at Arcotel Velvet were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a great location if you want to stay in Mitte and are interested in a more bohemian area. Numerous buses, trams and the underground are available outside the door of the hotel so the shopping districts and sites are within easy reach. I would recommend the Welcome card for short stays. A 48 hour or 72 hour travel card are available which also act as a discount card for some museums and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sunred
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through laterooms.com. Not the cheapest in Berlin, but we wanted to be in a good location and in a hotel of a decent standard, and we were very pleased with this choice. The Mitte district is very central to all attractions, and the hotel has lots of plus points in its location. A variety of bars, cafes and restaurants are in the immediate neighbourhood. The hotel has excellent transport links with tram, S bahn and U Bahn- all almost on the doorstep, so it's quick and easy to get around. The day passes for the transport system are really good value, especially as a family-15 euros for unlimited travel for a day for 4 of us. Try the Oranien cafe for a fab breakfast. (Turn right out of the hotel, walk down to where you see the S bahn and it is on the opposite corner). Beautiful setting, large round tables, very light and spacious, newspapers, mags available for relaxing with. We were there on a Sunday just after 10am, but it filled up very quickly after that time.We didn't try the hotel for breakfast as this cafe had more choice and was better value. Also try one of the small cafes across from the hotel (to the left as you look from the hotel)- very good, but the service is slow, so not if you're in a rush! The cafe next door is also good for a coffee and cake. Hackesher Mkt is worth a visit. Only a couple of stops on the tram. Walk round the corner from the hotel to get the tram on the way, but on the way back the tram stops just opposite the hotel. Good shops, cafes, restaurants and entertainment. We ate at a Spanish tapas bar and it was a good evening.Also useful for a supermarket if you want to buy some bottled water, snacks etc. Another dinner recommendation is the Cuban restaurant. Turn right out of the hotel, cross the road and it's just down there. Good range, healthy portions and good value. Don't eat at the Italian on the corner next to the hotel -very average. Overall, we found eating out in Berlin to be really good value when compared to other European cities, and even to places in the UK. Plus, the food and service is MUCH better than the UK! Some reports say that the hotel is noisy. It was fine when we were there, but perhaps at different times of year..? Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Re the rooms- very clean, and modern. We really liked them. If you read other reviews you will know that the shower and sink are open to the bedroom apart from a thin curtain, however, it really isn't a problem as the mirror pulls over screening most of the area. Also, it can be an advantage as the mirror is double sided, so if 2 people are trying to get ready at once, you can have one on each side! The toilet is separate. We liked the security aspect of the hotel- you have to put your room key into the lift, and it only stops at that floor, so no one else can access it. Didn't like the lounge/ bar in the hotel - cold (but it was February), smells of smoke and overpriced compared to every bar within 30 seconds walk. Cocktails and beer abound on every bar menu and lots of happy hour offers. Worth visiting -Alexander Platz tower, Tiergarten,outdoor art gallery (graffitti art on the wall), Berlin Zoo, - lots of other attractions depending on your own taste. We would stay here again, as we feel it is the best location, and probably one of the best hotels in the Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value. Contemporary look was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: schombo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Hotel Velvet and was very pleased. We booked the suite on the 7th floor and felt we got great value for the money. Hotel Velvet is located basically at the corner of Orianburg Strasse and Fredrich Strasse. It's a 15 minute walk (max) to Museum Island or 15 minutes to Under Den Linden. If you don’t want to walk, there is an S Bahn stop 1 block away and the tram is either right in front of the hotel or a 2 block walk, depending on which direction you are headed in. Lots of restaurants and bars on Orianburg Strasse; Hackesher Hof is just a tram stop away and has even more places to eat and drink. Buffet breakfast was very good, service was very good as well. Orianburg Strasse is a Berlin night hotspot so expect to hear some street noise through the double glazed windows. TV had 30+ channels including CNN International and BBC.

Reviews.Title: “Great design less than average services”
Reviews.Author: gwatkinson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. This is one of the best designed hotels that I have stayed in anywhere in the world at any price. To top it off he price is not bad either. If you want to splurge the suites are great, the double rooms are not bad either. I would only change the height of the bathtub (it is too tall to get in and out of easily). The location is great with easy access to transportation. Unfortunately this is where the good ends and the bad begins. This is a hotel designed to represent the 21st Century but has few of those features. Wifi only in lobby and does not work well. Hot portion of the breakfast buffet is generally cold after 9 even though they serve till 11. On a previous trip they ruined a new jumper (sweater) just bought at Etro down the street and after being contacted the management referred me to Austria to their corporate offices who said that they would check into my claim and get back to me. I am still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, Funky, Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cyenti
Reviews.Content: We loved the Arcotel Velvet -- the design theme was consistent throughout the hotel and incredibly inspiring. The room was large, spacious, and unique -- the sound system was perfect for listening to newly-bought CDs from Dussmann's -- the bathroom was a bit odd, since it converted into a full shower. We weren't sure if this was a design move or if we were in a disability-focused room. The bar has expensive but hand-crafted drinks and free internet. The area was fantastic and alive -- lots of Indian and Singapore food, youth, Vegas-like prostitutes (the other reviews are spot on...they're there but not pushy or annoying...more funny) and nearby shopping. If traveling to the hotel via public transport, take the U-bahn to Orianenburger Tor...it is much closer and convenient than the S-bahn to Orianenburger Strasse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: IHATERASELIK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews and was not disappointed.Stayed for 3 nights,asked for a room at the front,view of the Oranienburg Strafze,which we got. Check in was easy,very helpful and polite staff,all spoke English well.Rooms were smart,very clean,and the open plan bathroom/shower set up was great.Flatscreen TV,DVD,CD included,plus A/con. The full drop windows at the front were very revealing,so care should be taken when drawing the curtains,otherwise the whole street will see you in all your glory ! Paid £270 for 3 nights,booked with Venere,com. Breakfast was buffet style,with a good selection,cost 12 euro's per person.We did not have this with our room booking and found lots of nice cafes in the surrounding area that were much cheaper,although we did have breakfast on the Sunday for convenience. The hotel bar was nice but a bit expensive for my liking,8 + euros for a basic cocktail,but it did not stop us enjoying a night cap or two. The hotel is located in Mitte and very handy for the tourist attractions,Reichstag,TV Tower,River Spee etc.,with trams running right past the doors of the hotel. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonable hotel in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Amazed by Arcotel Velvet”
Reviews.Author: geheimnis
Reviews.Content: I used credit card reward points to book a room at the Arcotel Velvet for my mother and I who were passing through Berlin on our way back to the States. We were both wowed by the impecable style, orientation to detail, and service we experienced at Arcotel Velvet. Unexpectedly, we were given the large street-facing suite on the 6th floor. The accomodations and view were unbeatable and I appreciated that I was extended the curtosey of being placed in this fantastic room. We were also extreemely pleased with the quality and service we experienced at Lutter & Wegner resturaunt, located in the first floor of the hotel. Following a fantastic dinner, we were able to rent and enjoy an English-language DVD thorough the hotel (this did involve a short 3 block walk to the rental store, but was simplified by the use of the hotel's membership card and return-service). I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone with modern sensibilities looking for a unique and tasteful hotel experience in East Berlin. I plan on returning myself!

Reviews.Title: “Still exceptional”
Reviews.Author: madserGalway4
Reviews.Content: While i would take on board the last review and the issue of overcharging this hotel still represents superb value for money given the location and the excellent rooms. I have stayed here on numerous occassions over the last two years and have always found the service excellent and the value for money exceptional. There are numerous cafes/restaurants in the area, so the breakfast option is worth skipping, unless you are in a rush. The suites are extremely spacious with fabulous views and if you can get a similar room in London, Edinborough or Paris for less than twice the price i would be surprised. All in all a great choice for location, room and service - any shortcomings of the bar and breakfast are more than compensated for by the myriad of choice on the hotel doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp practice”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Wigan
Reviews.Content: It's a shame to see this hotel sliding down the Trip Advisor ratings. This is a good hotel that is in a truly excellent location however I guess some of the staff are just upsetting their clients. I booked this hotel directly with the internet, booking superior velvet rooms for my group at their internet rate of Euro 115,00 per night. However, upon leaving the hotel realised that they had charged me a rate of Euro 139,00 per room per night. Okay, I should have had my wits about me (but had a heavy night previously) but the hotel will not respond to my e-mails nor will anybody in authority return my calls. They simply do not seem to care now that I have left. Having said that, the rooms (at the front) have a tremendous view of the street, are bright, spacious and clean. The furnishings are funky and modern with lots of nice touches. Make sure you get a room overlooking the street as the picture windows are great (and maybe better than the suites on the top floof?). There are rooms with a more 'traditional' bathroom than discussed in other reviews. Disabled / superior rooms will have the traditional bathroom style although it is more of a wetroom than a bathroom. People have raved about the breakfast on this site but to be honest it is rather ordinary. There are much better and far funkier places to eat for better food and better value. Similarly, when surrounded by so many bars, it's pretty pointless staying in the hotel bar which is smart but fairly dull but massively overpriced. The location is excellent for the S-Bahn and for the trams and there is a great choice of nightlife in this area. However on Oranienburgerstrasse, be aware of the pushy (but non-aggressive) drugs dealers who try and ply you with coke and hash. I mean, even my 71 year old father was offered some (and he doesn't quite look like a user...)! Also be aware of the very pushy prositutes. They all look the same with orange tans, bleached hair, skinny jeans and bum bags. I'm sure that they'll leave you alone if you are a couple but they really want to ply you with their services. All harmless enough though! Berlin is a great place, especially the old east, the hotel is in a great location, just take confirmation of your booking with you when paying or the staff at th Arcotel Velvet will sting you for full rate. Very sneaky! I have been to Berlin previously and will be back again. So watch out Arcotel, I'm coming back for my cash! Grr!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location - not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghHerbie
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the location - but the hotel did not live up to expectation. We booked a junior suite - it was very small - with only one chair. We had no water at all in the room one day - reception wasn't helpful nor indeed apologetic. The hotel tried to charge for things not used from the mini bar - and really pushed it when we said 3 times that we had not had anything from the mini bar. So all in all - there are some really great bars, cafes and restaurants nearby - use them but stay somewhere else. I've been to Berlin numerous times - this hotel ranks lowest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJWLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite on the 7th floor over a weekend in March. I chose it because of its location, although we found that the Hackescher Hofe and Oranienburger Strasse themselves are much more touristy than they were even 5 years ago. The room was great - fantastic view over the nearby rooftops from one side and out onto a shared terrace on the other. Staff were very helpful - available when you needed them, unobtrusive otherwise. The barman, Jan, really knew his stuff and made us some excellent drinks based on what he knew we liked - ask him for a recommendation or something personalised. This isn't the cheapest hotel in Berlin but it's well worth paying the extra for.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: corkman2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the arcotel velvet for 3 nights from the 10 th of March to the 13 th. In word it was just excellent, a great location to explore the city. The staff were just excellent and so helpful. The breakfast has to be the best breakfast in Berlin, such a choice and buffet style....you can even have a glass of sparkling wine!!!! The rooms and decor were fab!! So spacious and trendy!! Unlike other hotels the photos are exactley like the photos!! I will definetly return to Berlin and the arcotel velvet!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is simply very cool and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MattSt.Albans
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Acrotel Velvet and we were well and truly bowled over! We stayed in a Suite on the 7th floor which was just superb. The view was fantastic and the suite was large, spacious and made really speacial by the floor to ceiling windows. Also, if you are looking for cool shops, bars and a slightly 'edgy' feel then this hotel is in the best part of Berlin. Staff were great, giving excellent advice on what bars/clubs to go to and the check in/check out was seamless and easy (we even arrived at 10.00am and were given our room straight away). Would definitely go back...Berlin Rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been great Hotel if we had'nt been double booked!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacktim
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching this Hotel and chose it due to the great location with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Although we booked it 5 months in advance, when we arrived at the Hotel on Fri 9th Feb, we were informed by the Duty Manager that there were no rooms, as due to an internet error the Hotel had been over-booked. We had booked a Superior room, as it was our anniversary, and was furious when we were told they were taking us by taxi to another Hotel about 10 mins drive away and we would have to go back the next day!. The other Hotel was OK, but we didn't get a Superior room and there were no bars or restaurants nearby. The next day we returned to the Velvet and kicked up a fuss and they did book us into a Suite for the next 2 nights with breakfast included. The Suites are fantastic and we did have a great time in Berlin, however a very shaky start to a weekend away!!.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfactory start but generally good”
Reviews.Author: pollyIreland
Reviews.Content: i am just back today from a long weekend in this hotel, and although generally the experience was enjoyable, i was annoyed about how i was treated checking in.i had booked superior room on the internet, and as we were given the room keys i thought i would double check it was superior.the receptionist told me that it was not as they had overbooked and there was none available.i was disapointed but was ok about it until i said i presumed we would be charged for a standard not superior.she told me i would have to pay the rate for the superior room.at this stage i said i had a booking slip with a superior room on it and i should not have to pay superior prices for a standard room that they had overbooked.she grabbed the room cards off me, and then gave me a superior room without even saying anything. i was annoyed as i really felt she felt she could be rude as we look young and were casually dressed. i also query whether the room given was a superior as it did not seem like one-room 402 if anyone knows could they post it on this page.i would like to highlight that our stay was really enjoyable, rooms were spotless,hotel was central and the rest of the staff were really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaybee
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here at the end of Jan. The whole experience was very enjoyable. The staff couldn't be more helpful, always friendly and tried to answer all our questions. Due to other trip reviews we booked a fourth floor room to avoid any noise. I imagine it could get noisier in the summer when the local restaurants are busy but we didn't hear a thing. The room was cool - I loved the floor to ceiling window - but only stay with someone you are close to as the bathroom isn't seperate (fortunately, the toilet is). However, it's all really well designed. Most importantly, the location is excellent. You are able to walk to cool shops, cafes, bars and restaurants as well as easily get to other Berlin attractions. If you want shiney tower blocks, don't stay here. If you want interesting streets, old buildings, cool squares, do stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: After searching high and low for a hotel in Berlin Mitte I chose the Velvet based on the reviews it had gotten. This hotel in bang in the middle and accessile to all areas. Its spotless and the bar when you come though to the lobby does great cocktails. Be warned they are very expensive. Our room was on the 4th Floor and was a deluxe but to be honest i do not think there is much of a difference only ours overlooked some makeshift courtyard out the back. This was recommendxed to me as the front can be very noisy. All rooms seem to have the same decor and layout. The bathroom is separated from the room by curtain. I really like this idea it feels less cramped. This hotel is suited to anyone who is in berlin for a weekend break and wants to have easy access to all areas. The staff are great and the breakfast was fantastic. I would have no complaints whatsoever with this hotel only 2 vodkas with 2 mixers cost €17.30 at the bar !!

Reviews.Title: “Different...!”
Reviews.Author: Coyoacan
Reviews.Content: An interesting hotel....but heck its Germany..! We visited Berlin in mid Jan 07 and stayed at the Arcotel Velvet. After a very warm welcome - and some efficient service before hand (changing a booking) we entered our room. For those of a traditional disposition - be warned - there are condom packs and an open bathroom (the loo is enclosed!). The room design worked well - the beds comfortable and the room service efficient. I can't comment on the breakfast or bar, but the restaurant next door (where breakfast is hosted) is excellent. This hotel is very well situated for the main rail station (5 Euro cab fare) and for both the U Bahn and S Bahn. Not my usual choice of hotel - but you know what - I would recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Well-placed and funky, but less than comfy”
Reviews.Author: Fergieweb
Reviews.Content: First impressions were excellent and the check-in was smooth and welcoming. The room design really creates more space with an open bathroom area but still retains the private toilet as there are things a loving couple shouldn't share! I travelled with my girlfriend to see in the New Year in style, but unfortunately despite getting decently intoxicated and stumbling home around 3am, we were kept up until at least 6 by the club next door and fireworks down the street. Not entirely the hotel's problem, but you do pay a price for floor-to-ceiling glass! Oh, and did I mention the fire alarm went off at 9am New Years Day and none of the staff seemed to have a clue what was going on? I reckon only 10 guests bothered to leave their rooms... My only other minor complaint was that the beds weren't that comfortable, but maybe we're just spoilt at home... As for the rest of the hotel, the bar was fantastic if not a bit on the stuffy side of cool. Great cocktails though! Didn't make it to breakfast, but it looked excellent and the variety of restaurants and bars nearby is fantastic. Definitely recommend QBA! To sum it up, great place to go and have a fun mini-break in this amazing historic city, the hotel is in a great location for getting to all the sights. Just don't stay in the Velvet if you want to completely relax!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room and location!”
Reviews.Author: IAMX
Reviews.Content: If you like comfort, uniquely designed rooms and unpretentious luxury, I would highly recommend a stay at this lovely hotel. Our stay was for 5 nights, and we wished we could have stayed longer! The central location is perfect for city exploration, being close to the bohemian Mitte district, near good quality restaurants and bars. Transport links are within 1 mins walk. Staff were excellent, friendly and courteous. The cocktail lounge is a nice place to relax, and the prices arent bad. Free internet, arty films and interesting decor complete the look. I would highly recommend a visit to the galleries adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and price”
Reviews.Author: the_hair_thief
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, with trams and U-bahn basically on your doorstep. The staff were very friendly, and rooms were stylishly decorated with flatscreen TV and CD/DVD player. Having the bath and sink in an open plan type way was different (in a good way) and toilet was separately enclosed. Floor to ceiling window provided great view. I was slightly concerned, reading the other reviews, about the prostitutes who were around, but don't be, as they don't bother you (maybe if you were a single or group of males you may get their attention) but it really just adds to the uniqueness of Berlin. We had 3 nights in Berlin, which wasn't really enough and will go back (and stay at this hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Que
Reviews.Content: Arcotel Velvet is in the perfect position right in the middle of the central district, Mitte. There are a wide range of restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk and it's conveniently placed a couple of minutes from a U-Bahn for easy access to everywhere you will want to visit. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful, from the receptionists to the bar staff and the maids. The room was on the first floor facing the street and could possibly be a little noisy for some, but we had no trouble sleeping. The windows do come right down to floor level though, so you may want to close your curtains as there is a restaurant directly across the street! Although the toilet is separate, the bath/shower and sink area is only partly screened from the bedroom by a sheer curtain - we didn't have any issue with this, but it's something to bear in mind if you are travelling with a friend rather than your partner (I'm not sure whether there are twin rooms, so maybe they are different?). Everywhere was clean and tidy and well-maintained. The room is relatively well equipped with toiletries but there is no shampoo provided and no coffee making facilities in the room which would have been nice. There is a mini bar with a variety of soft and alcoholic drinks, snacks and other items at typical hotel prices. Even if you don't purchase anything, you can empty it out and use it to keep your own drinks cool. The bartender was very good and would make drinks to your own specification if you wanted. The free internet just off the bar area was extremely useful. The hotel reception area has wide range of Berlin guide books in English which was a nice touch - many of them giving information not found in the books we had read. Mitte is definitely THE place to stay in Berlin and this hotel offers such excellent value (we paid about £60 a night for a double room in July).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MazzaB
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend. Stayed at the Arcotel for 4 days in August. The hotel location is very central, beside both U (U6 Orianburger Tor) & S Bahn (Orianenburger Str). It's on a street with loads of restaurants and bars. The hotel itself was spotless, newly and tastefully decorated. The staff were really funny, friendly and helpful. The only drawback this hotel had for us, was at the weekend, some people came back shouting and banging on doors, not sure if they were actually staying in the hotel or had slipped in. Otherwise, this is a great hotel and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “believe what you read”
Reviews.Author: RJButt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Berlin many times over the past several years. Believe what you read on this website: for value, location, transport connections, groovy bar, friendly staff, decor, (I could go on and on), this is undoubtedly the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin was Great and so was Arcotel Velvet!”
Reviews.Author: Heartyoz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Arcotel Velvet - it was great, I thoroughly recommend it. I had scanned the reviews of hotels and whittled it down to 2, the AV and the Golden Tulip. To help me decide I asked for advice from one of the local experts on TA and based on location they said the Velvet was best given our short stay, and it was just perfect. There was a tram and tube stop right by the hotel, although from the airport we got a taxi which cost 35 Euros including tip (but as we found our bearings during our stay we got the train back to Schonfeld airport for 2.10 Euro each!) . At the hotel on arrival we had a warm welcome and we got a non-smoking room on a higher floor (5th) that I had requested, I would probably say that it is worth staying on higher floor if you are a light sleeper (or go to bed early) as the street was buzzing all night, saying that though the thick glass did seem to cut nearly all of the noise out. The deal we got on the web did not include breakfast so we pre-booked that at the hotel the night before (it was cheaper if you did this at 12 Euro) although I only got this tip from the TA site, the reception did not actually point this out, just suggested we booked. However the brekkie was fantastic and I think worth it, everything you could think of (including sparkling wine if wanted), it certainly set us up for the day, and even if you did not see what you wanted they would get it for you, (e.g. eggs and also any coffee you wanted not just Americano). The rooms were immaculately clean and well presented, beds comfortable, soaps, shampoo, fluffy white towels, in-room safe, TV). From other reviews on TA I got the impression that all of the bathroom was incorporated in the bedroom (separated by a curtain) but in fact the toilet was totally separate….I thought it was a really good design, kind of quirky, nice and modern. There were loads of nice touches like a bottle of water and some mints in a bag on arrival…also some apples in the room too. As a tip, I checked out the hotels own web-site just after booking and it was doing a 2 night weekend break special with breakfast at a better rate than I got. The location was perfect for all the sights and for plenty of bars and restaurants which were right outside the hotel door! With regards to sightseeing, I would personally say do a bus tour (we paid 15 Euros each) with a live commentary, as this will give you the orientation of Berlin. We then went back to the places we wanted to have a closer look at by walking or using the trains. (One down side with the bus was that it advertised as Hop on Hop off, 5 stops but ours would only let us get off at one, we used the Berlin company) All in all we loved Berlin and and the Arcotel Velvet and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Something different....”
Reviews.Author: PCfoodlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in October 2006. We checked in quite early and this wasn’t a problem, which was nice! Found the receptionist a little bit rude and she didnt really explain anything. Or mention breakfast. However, the room was quite nice with a flat screen TV and DVD player. (but DVDs are five Euros to rent) The bathroom and room are kinda integrated and you dont have a bath. You do have a huge shower with a free shampoo and showergel dispenser. The view from the room is great and you can see the various restaurants. The room is quiet (apart from our neighbours that played punk music from 7am). These aren’t any tea or coffee facilities inside the room only a mini bar. But I would recommend the Ambulance coffee bar next door. It serves the most amazing lattes in tall glasses and lovely bagels and smoothies. It has lovely leather couches. A great place to relax over breakfast and plan your day. Another must is the Dada Falafel located across from the hotel. The best falafel I have ever tasted and very good price. Go for the bit of everything dish. Also check out the little Vietnamese restaurant called Mango. It is about a ten-fifteen minutes walk (check your guidebook). The tube system is nearby and everything at your disposal. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weir_belfast
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. It's worth getting a fourth floor upwards room. Really comfortable and clean and in a great location on Oranienburger Strasse. Don't let let the 'ladies of the evening' that frequent the neighbourhood put you off - it adds to it somehow! I loved the decor in the hotel though it may not be to everybody's taste. The windows (floor to ceiling) look out right on to the street - you can't hear a thing though it's very atmospheric. It's also right beside Tacheles which used to be an artist's squat - it now houses artists' studios, an art hosue cinema and a couple of bars with a huge beer garden. Completely run down but amazing and full of character. Lots of great graffiti too. Can't recommend it highly enough. Not for families though. A great base for exploring Mitte and would recommend for young(ish!) couples.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Geordie Pensioner
Reviews.Content: The biggest regret about our visit to Berlin and the Arcovelvet was that we only booked for two nights. We requested a front facing room on the 2nd floor and that was exactley what we got. The floor to ceiling glass wall overlooking Oranienburger Strasse gave a birds eye view of the restaurants and evening strollers. The atmosphere was terrific The bathroom being part of the bedroom.( separated by a transparent curtain ) was differerent but never a problem. The Reception Staff were very helpfull and informative as was the Turkish taxi driver from Schonefeld airport ( fare 30/35 Eur.) Because of the many cafe,s and restaurants only 2mins walk from the hotel we didn,t use the hotel facilities but those who did seemed to be well provided for A hotel my wife and I would be keen to return to but next time for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ausyuppy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on hotels.com and based my decision on other reviews on tripadvisor.com. All I can say is that this is the best hotel I have stayed at in a very long time. The service you receive from the minute you walk into the lobby is brilliant. Most of the personnel in the lobby speak english, so communication is reasonably easy. I had a few "technical difficulties" getting the internet going, within minutes of a phone call the hotel handyman was at the door. The room we received ended up being a disabled room. This hotel caters for everyone. The room was very large and the bathroom was equally as big. One downside to the room we had was the shower was integrated into the whole bathroom, hence if you have a shower, the toilet gets wet as well. This is due to the disabled setup. It just requires prior planning before your shower :) Not all rooms are like this. From looking at the emergency exit plan in the hallway, the rooms come in all shapes and sizes. The bed was strange to say the least. It was two king single beds joined together at the base, but the mattresses werent, so there was a gap inbetween the mattresses. I dont know whether this is normal, but it didnt worry us too much. The room had floor to cieling windows which was good. The room also came with a DVD player and a LCD TV, albeit a small one (approx 20") The location is fantastic. A tram stop is right outside the door, there would be at least 15 restraurants / food outlets in the street where the hotel is located. The selection caters for all budgets. The streets are quiet, and safe. Nightlife is very busy with all the restaurants about. The hotel is about 5 minutes in a cab from Haptbahnhof station and about 10 minutes from Ostbahnhof station. There is a coffee shop next to the hotel that has free Wireless internet. The internet in the hotel rooms (via LAN) costs 9 Euro for 12 hours, or 3.50 Euro for 30 mins. They also supply two computers in the lobby for free internet. There is hotel WIFI available in the lobby area. The hotel is very secure. You need your room key in the elevator to access your level only. I like this feature as it keeps unwanted people out of each individual floor. Cot facilities are available for infants, and high chairs also are available in the restaurant. The breakfast is worth the 11 EURO they charge. It is a massive banquet ranging from fruit, yoghurts, bread rolls, bread for toast, cereal, pastries, cakes, many juices, cold meats, its all available. I highly recommend this hotel, the room colours are all white, but thats retro I guess these days. Enjoy your stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome, my name is...”
Reviews.Author: Mamos1968
Reviews.Content: ... that's how we were welcomed by Maximilian (I think that was his name) in the nice, small, modern lobby of this Hotel. Friendly, helpful staff who seem to take pride in a job well done. And the very good first impression was followed by a lot more good impressions: great location (not noisy but still right in the middle of the action, close to major sights and right in front of public transport which will take you anywere), good value breakfast buffet, modern stilish rooms, a confortable bed, everything clean... A great place to stay. And if you fancy a drink at three in the morning, you'll even find that right on Oranienburgerstrasse. Alongside with other "amusement" provided by slightly clad ladies, who however are not agressive at all and leave you alone if you don't seem interested. Anyway, we loved our stay. If we ever go back to Berlin, there's no question in my mind about where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcrichton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the end of April in this excellent hotel which is situated in a central location just a short walk from the Freidrichstrasse Railway Station. The room was spotlessly clean with very modern decor. Staff were extremely helpful. There are many reasonably priced restaurants in Oraniensburger Strasse in close proximity to the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as I remember”
Reviews.Author: SDLeeds
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to Berlin and this hotel and it was just as good this time around! The only difference was that I was given a room at the front of the hotel which was a lot bigger and miore spacious. I had also made a few special requests when I booked the hotel and all of them had been taken into account. This hotel is in a perfect location (good for nightlife and central to all the sights) and excellent value for money. If you get chance, try the Lutter and Wegner restaurant next door (there is a door through from the hotel into the restaurant) I never ate there last time but wish I had because the food is delicious. Although slightly more expensive that the other restaurants in the area, I would definately recommend it. The Oranien cafe/bar down the road from the hotel also offers excellent value for money and very tasty breakfasts!! Should I ever visit Berlin again, will still not hesitate to stay at the Arcotel Velvet!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirchan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights during a weekend in Aug. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The Velvet Lounge bar downstairs had great cocktails at a resonable price. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Even the view of the internal walls were decked out with lovely colours! Who needs a view outside! Though I do know if you ask for a room on the top floor the views of the city are amazing! Great price for a great location. All the bars and restaurant you can choose from just down the road!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: katiegirlx
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a three night stay in Berlin at the Arcotel Velvet. We had a fantastic time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city. On arrival our group was given adjacent rooms on the third floor of the hotel. Both the room and the view from the floor to ceiling windows were great. Unlike other reviewers we did not notice any noise during the night. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is ideally located to explore Berlin. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Whitehurst
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Arcotel Velvet on a Sunday and a Monday night at the end of July. Overall it was a decent hotel, and I would certainly consider staying there again, although I would probably stay closer to Hackescher Markt. Pros: - Appears quite new, very clean, well-kept - Good air conditioning (rare in Berlin, as very few stores and bars seemed to have AC) - Large windows let in a great deal of light - Hotel feels safe and secure - Location is decent, especially if you want to go to cool bars at night Cons: - Mattresses are rather hard, and pillows are rather small and thin - Shower has no shower curtain (by design), and thus a modest amount of water splashes on the bathroom floor during a shower - Internet connection in the rooms is through a normal networking cable, not wireless. The desk will provide you with a networking cable if you need, but I think that they charge for this. Internet access in the room was rather expensive: 2.50 euros for 30 minutes, 9 euros for 12 hours, or 12 euros for 24 hours Other comments: - The flat-screen TV is nice and modern, with good speakers, but it seems a bit too small when viewed from the bed. A DVD player is also in the room. - The location is pretty decent. It is just a few doors down from Tacheles, which is a cool outdoor club that seems to have been cobbled together from scraps. There are also several other bars and clubs along the street. A few of the restaurants had large outdoor seating areas next to them. One of the Indian restaurants which was almost across the street from the hotel had a very large outdoor seating area that was decorated beautifully with many lights. The hotel is at the northwest end of Oranienburgerstrasse, very close to the Oranienburgerstrasse Tor U-Bahn stop. There are 2-3 doner kebab places nearby that are open very late. There is also a McDonald’s by the U-Bahn stop that is open until 02.00 or so. A café next door to the hotel, Café Ambulanz, is convenient for a “to go” coffee in the morning. The hotel is only a short walk from the Museum Island. There are almost no retail stores along Oranienburgerstrasse, so it is not an interesting street for shopping at all. While I liked the location of the hotel, I would rather have stayed down near Hackescher Markt, as the square there is surrounded by a number of restaurants with very large outdoor seating areas. Street performers would entertain in the square. It seemed like a nice and festive atmosphere. While it was only a few long blocks from the Arcotel to Hackescher Markt, it was a bit far at the end of the night. Hackescher Markt does have more people there, and it is close to an S-Bahn station, so the noise there is probably greater. I also liked all of the shops along the main shopping street, Kurfürstendamm. It was very pleasant to stroll along by the shops, and the area seemed nice and bustling overall. I will probably choose to stay near the Kurfürstendamm next time. - To summarize about the location: The Arcotel Velvet is close to some fun bars, including Tacheles, a few restaurants, and little else. I might have preferred the Hackescher Markt (a few long blocks from the Arcotel) at the other end of Oranienburgerstrasse, which is a beautiful square with a number of restaurants with outdoor seating, as well as a few bars; it seemed a bit more fun overall. I also really liked the area of the Kurfürstendamm (Ku’damm), a broad boulevard full of interesting shops and restaurants, which makes for a great stroll; it is rather far from the Arcotel. - The room numbers are backlit numbers beside the door. Unlike another reviewer, I did not find them hard to spot or read at all. When you are in your room, you insert your card key into a slot near the front door in order to turn on the power to the room (which was explained well at the front desk). When you do so, it also changes the light on your room number from green to red. Thus, when you are in your room, your room number is red, and when you leave your room (and take your card key with you), the light changes to green. This is nice because it is like an automatic “do not disturb” indicator. However, it also obviously lets anyone else on the hallway know that you are not in your room. The hotel seemed very safe and secure, so I really was not bothered by this, but I figured I would point it out for anyone who might be concerned about this. - Another reviewer or two mentioned that there are streetwalkers on the street by the hotel. I did not see any near the hotel, and I only saw a few when I walked down Oranienburgerstrasse to Hackescher Markt. Perhaps it is different on a Friday or Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Arcotel Velvet -- great location, but enough problems to irritate”
Reviews.Author: DrStroke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in a Velvet suite in this Arcotel property in Mitte during July 2006. We paid 210 euros for the first two nights and 310 for the final night (which was the day before the World Cup final in Berlin, hence the price increase) booked on the arcotel web site. Breakfast was an additional 15 euros per person each. The suites are on the top floors and have floor to ceiling windows with great rooftop views over Mitte. Some of those windows look out onto one of Berlin's (in)famous beach clubs with trucked-in sand and lots of loud music. External blinds were in place, apparently to shield the room from the noise; our blinds didn't work initially and, when fixed, didn't shield much. We needed ear plugs to sleep. The air conditioning only worked in the bedroom; the living room part of the suite didn't have any vents, so it stayed quite hot throughout our stay, almost to the point of unusability. There is a little kitchenette from Ikea, but no real way to prepare anything except ice cubes and coffee; don't expect to use these suites like an apartment-hotel. For all the space in the suite, the bathroom was too small. Even at 210 euros, we don't think we got much value for money as we couldn't comfortably use the entire suite. Unlikely we will return to the Arcotel Velvet.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gravemaurice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year and can't fault it. Brilliant location - plenty of bars, restaurants nearby. Good for transport. Funky rooms and one of the best hotel bars I've ever been to. Top notch all round.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in. It is a fairly new hotel which is located in a very lively area on the east side. The street is filled with restaurants and bars and lots of people. It is very close to the U-bahn as well. The rooms are very spacious and decorated in an arty & modern way and was also very clean. The walk-in shower is huge - one of the biggest hotel showers I've even seen, and something we missed when we stayed at other places on our trip! We faced the back of the hotel so it was pretty quiet. Someone mentioned the prostitutes on the street - it definitely didn't come across as a sleazy neighbourhood at all, and these girls all look like models and are pretty harmless. One thing we didn't like is that when we put the do not disturb sign on the door, our room got cleaned anyway. I think this might be due the fact that we weren't in the room (as you have an electronic key you have to have to use the facilities and it indicates when you are there or not, but that's not big deal). We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Extra-wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only and I think that we found OUR hotel in Berlin. Magnificent, very modern, clean and interesting in every small detail hotel (for ex, on soap is title "I am your soap":)). we paid for hotel 150 euro for 1 night and it was during Football champ in Germany, so I think such hotel could cost even more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: johnti006
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. It is in the middle of the "action" in Mitte. There were people up all night outside the hotel but it did not prevent me from sleeping. The rooms were very modern and the staff was great. The bathroom is funky with no real separation between the sink/shower and the room, but it worked for me. I would definitely stay here again as it was close to a lot of restaurants/sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: scarpia
Reviews.Content: First off, the warning: if you are looking for a quiet getaway, stay somewhere else. But if you want to stay in the heart of Berlin, in close proximity to musuems and historical sites, not to mention restaurants and galleries, this is the place. The hotel's main street is busy and if your room faces it, it sounds like there is a small riot going on outside until about 2 am. But it's a muffled enough and I used ear plugs to sleep and my husband had no problem with it. So ask for a room off the street if that might bother you, but otherwise you'll have a decent sized room, very clean, free computers in the lobby, and the best location you could want. The place tries hard to be hip but that's fine. Some people might mind that the sink and shower aren't in a separate room, but except for the lack of a shower curtain, I thought the room was fine. Best of all was the price. We found great deals and paid $138 for the most expensive night and closer to $100 for the other nights. Breakfast wasn't included as with other European hotels, but there are two coffee places in close proxmity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for long week-end, originally on the first floor but got moved to the 5th as I had been told the 1st floor can be noisy as the road in which the hotel is situated contains numerous restaurants and bars some of which dont close till 5am. Having said that, wewere not aware of any undue noise when we were out nor the sort of behaviour we would expect back home with so many clubs and bars.The room we had had no outlook but was very quiet and spacious. There were tea and coffee facilities, mini bar, fridge, sink, table and chairs, arm chair, LCD TV but only in German (other than BBC news). Super shower. Staff very pleasant and helpful, one minor criticism our room didnt get made up till about 4pm which is a bit annoying if you come back after few hours of sightseeing and just want to flop down somewhere. The U Bahn is very close but if its shop gazing you are after you might be better in the West side. The city is very large and the main attractions like the Reichstag and TV Tower (close to hotel) attract huge queues. The attached restaurant, provides wonderful breakfasts and huge meals of the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Terrific as the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: rojersey
Reviews.Content: We expected more after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. The place wasn't terrible. Quite clean and the neighborhood is fun and funky although the street is filled with prostitutes after dark.....and not long after dark either! The beds were very hard and the pillows a bit meager. Our room faced the back and was somewhat dark and gloomy. The hotel did nickel and dime us. If we wanted to use our phone card, connection was 2 euros. Hooking up our laptop in our room was likewise very pricey (although the lobby did have two free computers). Our welcome was also a bit strange. One member of our foursome (two married couples) prefers stairs to elevators believing that a little exercise is actually good for the body and soul. The somewhat arrogant reception clerk told us that there are no stairs, only an emergency fire escape. This turned out to be entirely untrue and I still cannot understand why she would stubbornly deny the existence of something that was actually there and well lit and quite accessible. All in all I would have to rate the Arcotel as fair and not nearly the bargain or luxury of the nearby Radisson which cost us for our last night in Berlin only 99 euros with free internet on our laptop and free 0800 calls as well as a free continental breakfast whereas at the Arcotel breakfast was 11 euros or eat out!

Reviews.Title: “As fantastic as everyone said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not really any need to write this as everyone seems to have said the same, but we had a really good stay here! Rooms were great with the huge windows and big walk in shower etc (nice not to have just a little shower over the bath) The location is brilliant, lots of bars and restaurants literally across the road and within a few minutes walk (would particularly recommend Monseiur Voung, a Vietnamese place on Alte Schonauser about 10 mins walk away that was also really reasonable as well as great food) We didn't have any problem at all with noise despite being straight opposite the bars and only on the 2nd floor. Can't wait to go back sometime

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although I am bound to be biased, as it was my first ever upgrade (only as they mucked up the booking mind), I have to say this was a fantastic hotel. We didn't go for a breakfast option (breakfast is too good elsewhere in Berlin), so I can't comment on the food, but the rooms were lovely and spacious and extemely well appointed. (Our upgraded suite had two dvd players). The location is really good, at the end of Oranienburger Strasse and serviced by two tube stops and various trams and right in the centre of the "arty" action. There are pavement cafes and people milling around late into the evening, and it is a walkable distance from town should you not have walked enough around the extraordinary sights of Berlin. No gym, but nice bar and relaxed chic cool atmosphere. Reasonable staff as well, they only charged for one room for the two room upgrade to the suite. Ahhh Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ecookie81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here recently for 5 nights and were very impressed. We chose the hotel on the strength of the other reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel itself is very stylish and comfortable and looks great from both outside and inside and has more identity than many up-market hotels. Our room (a standard double on the second floor facing the street) was spacious, bright and nicely designed, I particularly liked the unusual bathroom layout, separated from the rest of the room by curtains, which, as another reviewer pointed out, means that you can watch the TV whilst in the bath! The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was great, lots of choice (we particularly enjoyed the pastries!) and the cocktails in the bar were delicious. The location is another plus, the U-Bahn is nearby and there lots of great restaurants and bars on your doorstep. (I would particularly recommend a Turkish restaurant called Hasir, which is down the road near the Hakesche Hoefe). We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan in Mitte!”
Reviews.Author: reviewerLondon
Reviews.Content: I looked at the reviews when I was planning my trip (6 months ahead) and booked so was lucky to get the 7th floor suites - with huge windows on either side - over Easter. (I note that the reviews are still as complimentary). For the price these rooms are superb - you would probably pay 3 or 4 times the price in New York for a similar penthouse feel. This set the tone off superbly as this is the happening and very cosmopolitan part of the City. Having not had too many expectations of Berlin it was a great break and prices in general are surprisingly reasonable considering it is a European Capital. The hotel is surrounded by bars and restaurants of every nationality and interestingly a whole plethora of cocktail bars. Trendy but inclusive - not elitist. This is particularly good if you are sightseeing over a weekend - as you can come back to the hotel after a full day, relax and then go out - everything is on the doorstep without having to worry about taxis/public transport. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the interesting sights and it's a vibrant atmosphere with the feeling of creativity and a generally positive mood. Don't forget to bring DVD's and CD's as you can play them in your room. The hotel has a link to a dvd store which is useful - they return them for you. If you want to get an insight into what Berlin was like around the time of the wall coming down (and you have time) rent Goodbye to Lenin (it's an amusing film). If you enjoy food and drink Berlin is surprisingly a good choice (dispelling the myths of endless Wurst and potatoes!). I think we would have had a completely different experience of Berlin had we not stayed in this area and particularly in this hotel- akin to staying in the meatpacking district in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on the strength of the reviews on this site and was not in the least disappointed. The staff seem to take a great pride in the hotel and seem genuinely concerned that guests are happy. The hotel could not be better situated as it is within easy walking distance of most of the major sights and public transport is on your doorstep. A wide range of restaurants is beside the hotel. Berlin is a great city with lots to see and do, and we have found on our two visits that people are very helpful and friendly. The room is laid out in a 'fun' way with an open shower area. One big disappointment was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. Surely this would be very cheap to provide! I am looking forward to our next visit to Berlin and will hopefully be staying at the Arcotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: px
Reviews.Content: good spot to stay in i found the area around the hotel great for eats and drink and my room for one was great plenty of room, pristine and the staff were really helpful definately return on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Elena_GR
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location is very convenient, the rooms stylish and well-equiped and the staff really helpful.All major sights as well as the shopping area of East Berlin (department stores etc) are very close. We didn't try the breakfast, as the breakfast served in Oranien (some blocks away) was excellent and much cheaper. The lounge-bar is very relaxing after a busy day and the coktails served very delicious (Try "Velvet Berry"!). There is free high-speed internet next to the bar, which we often used to find restaurants, clubs etc. We would definitely book at Arcotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after a lengthy cruise and it was a refreshing change with the most quirky and cool rooms. Our room had a total glass front with an open ensuite bathroom and a seperate WC. The spacious standard room was colourful and funky with a LCD screen and very comfortable beds. The hotel is in a great location in a hip part of East Berlin and is very central as well. Well worth a visit as reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Brighton_UKTim
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Berlin as a birthday surprise. The hotel was in a great location, just across the road from the U-Bahn, and a pleasant walk to Freidrichstr Station, Unter den Linden and Hackescher Markt. Mitte is in my opinion the best part of Berlin to stay - as the name suggests, it is the centre of the city. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the room as nice as it appeared on the web - well built unlike some "ikea" hotels which dominate this area of the travel market. We stayed in the front, so had fantastic ceiling to floor windows, overlooking Orienburgstr. One downer, we could hear trams when lying in bed at night. Finally, the design is great, but the sink and bath in the bedroom ( the toilet had a room of its own) may not be for everyone - I liked it, I could watch tv whilst bathing ! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgjazz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a frigid visit to Berlin. Despite the cold, the trip was great. The Velvet hotel is pristine. ALthough it is 2 years old, it seems brand new. Staff was helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean and well laid out. It's kind of like staying in the East Village in NYC or in West Hollywood/Melrose in Los Angeles. The hotel is on a block with the bizarre mix of funky hip boutiques and shops like Melrose Ave or the area aorund NYU, with a 150 year old synogogue (the "new" synogogue) museum, Singaporean restaurant (great), Mexican restaurant, McDonalds, Italian restaurant, Sushi restaurant, and others - yes, all on the same block in the former E. Berlin! Can walk 3 or so blocks to museum island and Hackeschecker Market. Can walk to 80% of major sites. For example, we took a cab to the Kulturforum/Sony Bldg and walked back to the hotel, viewing the Holocaust monument/museum, Brandenberg gate, Reichstag, and Unter Den Linden on a walk back to the hotel. Could have also included Gendarmmarket, but we had already been there. Tip: Jewish Museum offers Klezmer music in its restaurant on Mon. nights - reservation may be needed. Bus and train access is either right out the front door, or a short distance away from the hotel. Breakfast was great - good variety and high quality. Great breads, fruit selection, cheeses, yogurts, granolas, and more. Ask for various egg varieties and coffee options if your's isn't displayed or offered. Bar is quaint and comfortable. Internet access via two terminals is provided next to the bar. We were told that you can get wireless access for 4 euros for a half hour, so we went down the street to a cafe where it was 2 euros for an hour or 5 euros for a month. We were there from a Sun. to Tues., and the rate including breakfast for two was $118 euros (Sun and Mon) and $123 euros (Tues). Note: rates are apparently going up and may already be 20% higher.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible apartments in the bohemian part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Arcotle Velvet last August and thoroughly recommend it. We stayed in one of the "suites" - basically a two room apartment at the top of the hotel that was bigger than our London flat! And the price was very reasonable, too. The main view was along Oranienburgerstrasse, with a communal balcony at the back, giving views of the Fernshenturm and the Berliner Dome. A good sized bathroom, lounge area, two TVs and DVD players (!), kitchen area and a well-stocked mini-bar made this a very pleasant stay. Presumably the smaller rooms don't have all these features, but if you're there for a long weekend or a special occasion, you should treat yourself to the suite. There's potentially a problem if you're a family - the street has a busy nightlife and the other end of Oranienburgerstrasse towards Alexanderplatz can be a bit sleazy, but we were up for the arty, bohemian experience and loved it. In the summer there was a large outdoor bar area across the back of the hotel that was quite noisy, but I for one enjoyed listening to the music and watching the film shows from the comfort of our balcony - but beware if you want a quiet night's sleep! There is an art / bar building adjacent to the hotel which may put some people off, but it made this trip into the former East Berlin all the more fascinating.
