There are a couple of bars / food stalls opposite and a McDonalds and Spar shop on the corner for all your needs. Also, an Irish pub around the corner on Friedrichstrasse for the ex-pats. In brief - a funky young hotel with an excellent restaurant adjacent (where breakfast is served) and an extremely cool cocktail bar in reception. Staff were so friendly and helpful, everything was perfect for our stay. This hotel made me love Berlin even more...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: YUKOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early December 2005. Generally we liked it very much. we specifically went for one of the upper floor suites. This was very spacious and loved the sloping floor to cieling windows with remote controlled blinds. The bed and sitting area were very tastefully done. However, it appears every expense was spared in kitting out the bathroom. Whilst it was perfectly functional, there was no feel of luxury, all kitted out in white with no attempt to make it in any way feel special or different. This was disappointing. (same with the little kitchenette in the room too by the way). The breakfasts in the affiliated restaurant downstairs was German pastries, breads etc at their best. It's a full buffet so there's something for everybody. This is a must. The bar did not appear to attract many customers, so was always quiet - there are plenty of other bars about. The area is pretty cool, with some interesting arty clubs and bars in the area. It's also very well connected via U-Bahn to the rest of the city. I would go to Arcotel again when staying in Berlin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: katenadine
Reviews.Content: Great hotel – very modern, clean and comfortable, and with some funky, quirky touches that make it worthy of its fab East Berlin location. We stayed in a double on the fourth floor facing the street – it’s not a beautiful view, but it is colourful and the windows are great. It’s worth requesting to be high up in the hotel when you make a reservation. The bed was very, very comfortable, although the two single duvets were a little odd (we got used to them eventually). The room was much quieter than expected, the only noise being the hum of the air conditioning / heating. The carpet is a bit ugly – but this is the only thing I’d change. The staff were lovely and helpful, and were happy to make recommendations for restaurants, etc. The surrounding area is great for eating and drinking – we particularly like the pub outside the S-Bahn station on Oranienburger Strasse which serves hundreds of beers and some very tasty snacks and meals (it begins with A …). Overall, a fantastic hotel for the price (we paid 95 euros a night) and I will definitely stay there again when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect-Combines everything!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel Velvet in March 2004, for 4 nights. I found it on a website (never had heard of it before), and i must say the real thing was even better than the images on the internet. The location is fabulous (within walking distance to all major sites) and very vivid, but not too noisy. The entire building is decorated in a modern, yet friendly way. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the highlight are the huge windows (ceiling to floor) that have a great view over Oranienburger Strasse. The personnel is very friendly and helpful, and they were willing to recommend us great restaurants and bars. And all that for 110euros per night. In general, i would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a stylish and friendly central hotel, at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jenifertree
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at this hotel and couldn't fault it. I didn't expect the rooms to be as lovely as they were on the website but they didn't let me down. Clean, comfortable and stylish with amazing windows (try and get a front view). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Particular praise for the hotel bar ... Toby the barman makes a mean espresso martini and is excellent for advice on all the hot nightspots. Only word of advice (not the hotel's fault) is watch the taxi drivers ... we were totally scammed into going the long way round quite often .... i.e. try and learn where you are if possible! I would also recommend a visit to Weekends nightclub nearby in Alexanderplatz ... totally wicked with gorgeous views (the ones from the window weren't bad either!). All in all I would definitely stay at this hotel again ... in fact we are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayneTim
Reviews.Content: We can't praise this hotel enough! Well located in the Mitte (former East Berlin) district, close to U-Bahn and tram lines. Hotel and bar staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel offers a brilliant full buffet breakfast and free internet access in the front bar. The hotel is funky and hip, with a great decor. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good but not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ebarav
Reviews.Content: The first impression great rooms, but as time goes on not very well thought out from a function point of view. The Shower has a tap sticking into it at knee level ( the tap for the bath) and every time you turn you hit and bruse your legs. The TV great to get a plamsa tv but I asume most people look at it from the bed, it's not facing the bed, to swithc channel or control you have to get out of bed!! The DVD good toutch again but it's completly uncolotrolabe fromt he bed again by it's position . I found that it was poor value for money, you pay arround 110 euro a night but EVERYTHING is extra, with plasma tv and dvd player and hot lamp in bathroom with electrical blinds it would have been nice to have had a coffee maker!!! or free wirless internet or free breakfast!! I stayed in a hotel in berlin a week before at half the price including breakfast and with internet connection at free, and much friendlier staff ( the Comfort Auberge)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely impressed”
Reviews.Author: kwcm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arcotel on Thu, Fri night. Couldn't book on Expedia for Sat night because it was booked out. Instead I booked at another "design" hotel in West Berlin. I did however book Sun night at the Arcotel again before departing on Monday. Price - Exceptional value when you compare it to other hotels in Berlin. While it does not have the gym and pool type facilities, this is definitely a "design"/"boutique" hotel, rather than one which has hundreds and hundreds of rooms and therefore you're never going to get your rooftop pool or basement gym. Doing a search of Expedia, this is one of the cheaper hotels, but having stayed there for 3 nights, it certainly did not feel like one. Perhaps only the 15 euro breakfast which I did not bother with since (a) that is expensive and (b) I always prefer to have breakfast in a cafe on the street. Service - Excellent, friendly service. Staff had no problems with English. Polite and courteous. Was also very helpful in giving suggestions on dining. Rooms - Take a look at the panoramic camera on their websites. Very funky. I stayed in rooms facing the street. Just note that the wall to wall glass is not a one-way mirror. Don't worry as there are blinds to ensure your privacy. The open access bath/shower concept is also very cool (and unexpected). Although this may make it difficult in terms of non-couples sharing a room, I still think it adds to the "design" feel and definitely feel it was the right choice. Not to worry, the toilet is separated. Rooms have flat screen TV with cable and, a DVD player! So bring your own DVDs or CDs if you want to watch movies or if you want to play your own music. You can also choose to hire DVDs from reception if you wish. Also, the hotel has two free internet terminals in the bar for its guests. Location - Absolutely perfect. I didn't realise this until after about 7 days in Berlin (I stayed in the Circus Hostel for the earlier parts of the week). Essentially, West Berlin is boring and does not have much except for Ku'daam which is a shopping strip similar to Champs Elysees (ie lots of tourist traps and international brands which you can get anywhere in the world and is probably quite boring if you're interested in local styles and shops). Most of the sites are in East Berlin (in fact, the walking/biking tours I went on did not even go into the Kudaam region) and this hotel is pretty much in the middle of it. 2 stations from Friedrichstrasse station (one of the main stations). Tram directly in front of the hotel takes you straight to Unter den Linden. Underground station about 50 metres away is the train line to Tegel airport (via bus 128 connection to the airport). Oranienburger Strasse (the street the hotel is on) is also one of the busiest streets in East Berlin, with plenty of cafes/bars/clubs. Funky galleries within 200-300 metres. The much more interesting and funky shopping is at the end of Oranienburger Strasse in the Hackeshen Markt/Hofe area. And most of the sites are within walking distance of this area. I also highly recommend walking/biking tours as unlike other cities, it's the history that makes the buildings in Berlin interesting. I went on the all day walking tour Brewers Berlin Tours and the biking tour with Fat Tire Bike Tours Berlin. If you have time, the walking tour will be more informative. Otherwise, I highly recommend riding around Berlin, as it is one of the bigger cities. You probably can't go wrong with any of the walking/biking tours in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ARUANO
Reviews.Content: The velvet is an excelent choice if you want to stay in the middel of the trendiest area of Berlin. The rooms are modern, confortable and full of details (i.e. a DVD player in your room) The service is excelent; nice and willing to help. We didn´t have breakfast as the area is full of cafes where you can better spend the 15 euros. The rooms in the back can be a bit noisy in the early night (not a problem if you, and you will, want to sample some of the many bars or discos around.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: kevin72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location,1 block from the train station,very clean,quiet,AC worked fine. not bad for the price we paid on Expedia ($84) but the queen bed we stayed in wasn't comfortable for the 2 of us,mattress was very springy,you might be better off with 2 twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, relaxed hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bob+Diane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel Velvet for a long weekend at the end of July 2005. The hotel is very informal, it has a great bar (very chilled out), the rooms are very good (but ask for a street facing room, ours just overlooked a back courtyard). The integral bathroom works really well, there is a separate wc and the shower room & sink area is curtained off. The transport systems are good but many of Berlin's high spots are within walking distance of the hotel (with flat shoes!). There are a lot of art galleries in the area which are very interesting. On the last night we found a great spanish restaurant which served fresh, tasty food at very cheap prices plus nice wines by the glass and good beer. It is called Ruz, in Augustrase 63, telephone 28 09 77 88 (no need to book), about 5 minutes from the hotel. We will stay in the Arcotel nexttime we visit Berlin. Diane and Bob Williams, Liverpool

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Room Ever”
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was the coolest I have ever stayed at. Location was excellent as there are many places to eat right across the street and you are within walking distance of all the major sites. The staff was very nice and the price for a room and hotel of that quality is quite low.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel in May. The room was extremely clean, super modern with a funky bathroom. It had a DVD/CD player which we only discovered before we left beause it was really tucked away, so if you fancy it, take your music with you. The really great thing about this hotel, besides the room being fab, is the location. You are bang next to this fantastic arts centre called Tascheles, which looks like a dilapidated building from the outside but inside you can stroll through artists studios and it even has a tucked away tiny cinema. The Hotel is also next to the metro so you can get anywhere in anytime. I really recommend this as a place to stay in Berlin as a base to explore the city!

Reviews.Title: “Wild Times”
Reviews.Author: Katzen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May. Wonderful place. Super, sexy, cool! Huge shower area and comfy bed. Floor length windows ( funny, spooky effect when leaning just touching nose on glass and looking down...) Great entertainment watching 'ladies of the night' on duty in street below. Had flowers and champagne in room for arrival. Clean and stylish. Very helpful staff. Fantastic area. Great thai, indian and singapore food near by.
